“Gabriella! Stop!” Victoria frantically tried to pull her back, putting on a show. “Don’t listen to her! She’s talking nonsense! My sister is not a suspect! She doesn’t need to be tested…”

Officer Donovan Pierce stepped forward, test strip in hand. “Anyone who had contact will be tested.” He moved toward Isabella. A sense of foreboding settled in her gut…
###Chapter 123

Isabella Montgomery was forced into a chair. Her eyes widened as Officer Donovan Pierce approached.

He extended the test strip toward her. "Ms. Montgomery," he instructed, "briefly pinch this with your fingers."

The strip was partially damp, embedded with complex components. Any trace of halophilic bacteria on her skin would trigger a color change from white to purple.

The crowd turned on her, voices sharp with accusation. "You claimed innocence! Hurry up and do it!"

"Where's that arrogance now? Prove it!"

"Scared? We need to see the results!"

The taunts grew into a deafening roar. Cornered, Isabella had no choice. She reached out. Her fingers squeezed the strip.

It turned purple immediately.

She was guilty. The evidence was on her fingertips.

"I knew it! It's her! She's pure evil!"

"Just over some petty arguments? How could she poison us?"

"She's a viper! You'll pay for our medical bills! And our trauma! And our lost wages!"

The models erupted in fury, hurling abuse. Nathaniel Blackwood watched, his brow furrowed. This was unexpected. The cunning Isabella Montgomery, trapped?

Yet, she sat perfectly composed. A cold smile touched her red lips. Victoria had outdone herself this time. The plan was clever.

Isabella deduced the poison was on the juice bottle Veronica had handed her. She had contaminated her own hand disposing of it.

Since they wanted to play this game, she would play. And she would make it interesting.

Officer Pierce produced handcuffs. "Ms. Montgomery, you are under arrest for the intentional poisoning of your colleagues. Come with us."

"Fine," she replied, her tone breezy. She stood in one fluid motion. A swish of her long hair. She walked toward the police car, her steps confident, her aura undiminished.

She didn't look like a criminal being arrested. She looked like a CEO heading to a board meeting.

The crowd stared, baffled. No explanations? No denials? What was happening?

"She's scared stiff with the evidence," someone muttered.

The officers ignored them and got into the car. Victoria struggled to her feet, feigning weakness. "No... This is a mistake. It can't be my sister... She isn't capable of this. Please, don't take her."

"Victoria," Gabriella reasoned, "the evidence is right there. Why defend her? She's just an adopted orphan. Who knows what kind of criminals her real parents were!"

Victoria clutched Gabriella's shirt, her performance flawless. "Gabriella, I know her. She's not like that. Please, call Mother and Father. Have them hire the best detectives. Find the truth!"

Her face was a mask of frantic worry, perfectly convincing. Gabriella played her part with equal skill. It was a masterclass in deception.

The police car began to pull away.
###Chapter 124

The car door slammed shut.

Chris let out a piercing scream.

He bolted forward, tiny legs pumping furiously. "Mommy! Mommy!"

Nathaniel scooped him up in one swift motion. A large hand covered the boy's mouth, muffling the desperate cries.

He carried the struggling child through the main doors. The police car was already gone, vanished into the city streets.

Chris thrashed violently. He sank his teeth into Nathaniel's hand with all his strength.

Nathaniel's brow furrowed. He didn't release his grip. He shoved the boy into the backseat and slammed the car door.

The interior fell silent except for choked sobs. Chris realized they were alone. No bodyguards. No driver.

Tears streamed down his face. "Daddy! Why? Why did you stop me? Mommy needs us! She's innocent! I know she is!"

His small fists pounded against Nathaniel's chest. "Did you stop loving her? You're a traitor! A monster!"

Nathaniel caught the flailing hands. His voice was low and firm. "Enough. The authorities are handling this. What exactly did you plan to do?"

"I...I would have thought of something! I couldn't just watch them take her!" Chris wailed, his body shaking with grief.

"She wasn't taken," Nathaniel stated calmly. "She went with them willingly. There's a difference."

Chris sniffled loudly, confusion replacing some of the anger. "Huh?"

"Think," Nathaniel said, his tone softening slightly. "Remember all the other times? The impossible situations your mother has escaped?"

Chris nodded slowly, a flicker of hope in his wet eyes. "Mommy always fixes everything. She's amazing." His voice dropped to a worried whisper. "But this time...there's evidence. Real evidence. And it's a serious crime. How can she get out of this?"

"Trust her," Nathaniel replied, his gaze steady. "Has she ever truly failed you? Be quiet now. I will take you to see her."

"Okay," Chris whispered, wiping his face on his sleeve. Nathaniel sighed inwardly. Parenting was exhausting. First, he needed to check on Isabella.

The story exploded across every major news outlet within the hour.

[12 INTERNATIONAL SUPERMODELS POISONED.]

The headline screamed. [Initial reports indicate a backstage dispute led designer Isabella Montgomery to poison twelve supermodels. The victims include global sensation Seraphina Delacroix, America's sweetheart Victoria Kensington, and fiery French model Genevieve Laurent. All twelve received immediate medical attention. While Victoria Kensington has remained silent, the other eleven models are demanding a public apology, criminal charges, and fifty million dollars in individual compensation.]

[Mercedes representative Archibald Worthington issued a statement condemning Isabella Montgomery for sabotaging their annual auto show. The company is seeking no less than eighty million dollars in damages. Legal experts note that malicious poisoning causing significant bodily harm carries a potential three-year prison sentence.]

The comment sections boiled over with rage.

[She's a monster! How could anyone do this?]

[What a vile heart! A simple argument and she resorts to poison?]

[Her beauty is clearly only skin deep. A truly evil woman. I bet this isn't the first time!]

[That face hides a demon! Vicious! Cruel! Lock her up and throw away the key! I'm so angry!]

The internet had convicted her. The combined fury of twelve fan armies flooded Isabella's social media, burying any support under an avalanche of hate. Her reputation was shattered.

At the police precinct, Officer Donovan Pierce motioned toward a holding cell.

Isabella didn't move. "You're detaining me based solely on trace residue on my hands? What if I brushed against a contaminated surface? What if someone transferred it there during a handshake while I was distracted?"

Her voice was cool, analytical. "A conviction requires a complete chain of evidence. Have you located the source of the poison? Found the container it was held in? Obtained a confession from me?"

The distant hum of a vacuum cleaner echoed in the hallway.

Officer Pierce frowned, irritation flashing in his eyes. "You were cooperative at the scene. Why the sudden change? What game are you playing now?"
###Chapter 125

Isabella Montgomery met Officer Donovan Pierce’s gaze with unwavering seriousness. “To clarify, I am merely a suspect at this stage. I should be held in a detention room, not a prison cell.”

Donovan was taken aback by her precise knowledge of legal procedure. Everything she stated was factually correct. He nodded stiffly. “Escort her to a holding room.”

She was led into a sterile white space. It was a significant improvement over a cell. A metal-framed bed stood against one wall. A basic but clean lavatory was tucked in the corner.

The door clicked locked behind her. Isabella showed no concern. She moved with casual grace, surveying her temporary quarters before settling on the bed. Her gaze dropped to her hands. A faint, knowing smile touched her lips. ‘Go ahead, Victoria. Make your move while you can. The finale won’t be satisfying otherwise.’

A sharp rap echoed at the door. “Isabella Montgomery. You have visitors.”

She glanced toward the sound. Victoria Kensington, Eleanor Kensington, and Richard Montgomery stood outside. Isabella closed her eyes, dismissing their presence entirely. They entered without waiting for permission.

Eleanor’s voice cut through the quiet. “Isabella! How could you commit such a vile act? Poison the others if you must, but your own sister? Bringing you into our home was the gravest mistake! The shame you’ve brought upon us is immeasurable. And you just lie there! Get up and apologize to Victoria immediately!”

Isabella’s eyes remained shut. She offered no response.

Richard’s fury boiled over. He snatched a glass of water from a nearby table and hurled it. The cold liquid splashed across Isabella’s face before she could react.

Her eyes flew open. She rose from the bed in one fluid motion. Her expression was glacial, her eyes gleaming with a predator’s ruthless light.

Richard flinched under her stare, momentarily stunned. He quickly regained his composure, rage burning hotter. “Still no remorse! The Montgomery family wasted twenty-three years on you! If you refuse to confess and apologize to everyone you’ve harmed, we will publicly disown you. We will cut all ties and exile you from Westchester!”

Victoria’s eyes glittered with concealed triumph. If Isabella was cast out, her fifteen percent family shares would default to Victoria. She quickly moved forward, clutching Isabella’s hand with feigned concern. “Sister, please! Explain yourself to them! Tell them you’re innocent! I know you didn’t do this!”

“Remove your lying, pathetic face from my sight. Stop pretending to be a saint,” Isabella’s voice was a sharp, cold blade. Her gaze pinned Victoria in place.

Victoria recoiled, snatching her hand back. Her heart hammered against her ribs. Even locked up, Isabella’s presence was terrifyingly potent. This was a new level of fury.

Victoria retreated to the far side of the bed, her expression expertly crafted into one of profound hurt. Anyone watching would think she was the victim here.

Isabella seethed internally. The sight of Victoria’s manipulations fueled her anger.

Eleanor pulled Victoria protectively closer. “Victoria, stop. Don’t waste your kindness on her. Look at her defiance. She is utterly shameless! Stay away from her from now on. She is no sister of yours. She doesn’t deserve your compassion!”

Richard glowered at Isabella, his rage palpable. “Since you refuse to admit your guilt, don’t blame us for our severity. I will convene a shareholders’ meeting immediately. You will be expelled from the Montgomery family! I will have you driven out of Westchester!” With that, he and Eleanor hurriedly escorted a seemingly distraught Victoria from the room, as if the place itself contaminated her.

Without missing a beat, Isabella’s voice followed them, cool and clear. “Do take care. I won’t be seeing you out.”

Their steps faltered, shoulders stiffening with renewed anger before they quickened their pace. Silence reclaimed the room. Isabella picked up a tissue and calmly wiped the water from her face.
###Chapter 126

Isabella stared at the damp tissue in her palm. Her expression turned icy cold. Victoria always managed to deceive Theodore and Sophia. She had them completely under her control. Isabella could never compete in that regard. She couldn't pretend or manipulate like Victoria did. She lost because she refused to sink to Victoria's level of wickedness.

But soon, very soon, she would expose Victoria's true nature to everyone. After drying her face completely, she glanced at her outfit. Fortunately, she wore leather today. It repelled the water easily.

Isabella was about to lie down when footsteps echoed outside. She looked up to see a tall figure and a small one at her door. Nathaniel and Oliver stood there.

"Leave. I need to rest," she stated flatly. She then lay on the cot, turning away from them. Her current situation was precarious. Their association could drag them down with her. Furthermore, she had resolved to maintain her distance. The Auto Show had been their only connection. That event was over now. Their interactions should end as well.

Ignoring her dismissal, Nathaniel entered with Oliver. He closed the door firmly behind them. "Isabella," he said directly, "if you agree, I can hire the top private investigators. The best lawyers in the world."

"Don't waste your efforts. Stay out of this," Isabella replied, her eyes still shut.

Nathaniel sensed her emotional distance. He frowned, frustrated. He glanced at Oliver and gave a slight nod. Oliver understood immediately. He rushed toward Isabella's cot.

"Mommy! Mommy!" Oliver cried, leaping onto her. "I missed you so much! I was so worried! Sniff... When they took you away, I cried until my eyes swelled. Mommy, please hold me? Please? I really, really missed you."

Isabella had no time to react before Oliver buried himself in her arms. His pleading, adorable voice filled her ears. She sat up, gently pushing his small arms away. "Oliver, go back with your father. You shouldn't be here visiting me." A child shouldn't be exposed to a place like this.

But Oliver clung to her stubbornly. His little head pressed against her chest. "No! I won't leave! Mommy isn't bad! I want to stay with mommy! Daddy and I believe in you! Someone else set you up! I know you would never do that!" His voice was firm. His eyes shone with absolute faith.

Isabella's heart softened instantly. Since the incident began, no one had trusted her. Everyone looked at her with suspicion and judgment. Even her own parents assumed her guilt. They scolded her without letting her explain.

And now, this little boy declared his belief in her. She knew Nathaniel must have coached him. Which meant... Nathaniel believed her too.

They had known each other for such a short time. They shared no blood relation. Yet he chose to trust her... A bitter irony washed over her, mixed with another, warmer feeling she couldn't name.

She gently pinched Oliver's soft cheeks. "If you believe I'm innocent, then go home. Wait for my news. I'll be out very soon."

"Really?" Oliver's eyes sparkled with hope. "You have a special plan to get out? Like when Superman defeats the monsters? Right?"

Isabella nodded. "Yes, exactly like that. So Oliver needs to go home. Don't mess up my big plan, okay?"

"But I want to stay with you. You'll be scared here alone, right? It's so cold in this room..." Oliver looked around the bleak space. His face fell. Tears welled in his sorrowful eyes.

Just then, Dominic entered carrying a large bag of supplies. There was food, toiletries, and other essentials. He also held an enormous white rabbit pillow.

Nathaniel took the nearly two-meter-long pillow. He handed it to Isabella personally. "Take this. I'll bring Oliver home now."

Isabella was speechless. She stared at the childish pillow. Was he seriously expecting her to accept this?
###Chapter 127

Isabella really didn't want to take the rabbit pillow. But seeing Oliver was about to cling to her again, she reached out and accepted it with a sigh. "Alright, you can go now."

Only after she took the pillow did Nathaniel leave with Oliver, his movements elegant and composed. Isabella stared at the oversized rabbit pillow in her arms. Suddenly, the underground detention cell didn't feel quite as cold anymore.

She hugged the pillow and lay back down on the bed, trying to relax. But her mind kept flashing images of Eleanor and Victoria's cold, indifferent faces. They contrasted sharply with Oliver's and Nathaniel's trusting expressions. The two scenes were as different as night and day.

A tiny crack had formed in her icy heart. It was spreading slowly, almost imperceptibly growing wider... The detention room was bitterly cold, but the world outside was in complete chaos.

Not far from the police station, Maxwell, Harrison, and a few others stood in a tight circle. Many unfamiliar faces were also present, all taking turns discussing the situation.

"We need to find a way to get the Boss out."

"I say we just break her out of jail!"

"Should we blow the whole place up?"

"Maybe we should bring in an expert to handle this."

"The best solution is to involve Kirk. He can solve this and help the Boss! He'd be thrilled to help!"

As soon as someone said that, everyone pulled out their phones, ready to take action. Julian rushed over and said coolly, "Everyone, go home and wait calmly for news."

"Huh? Why should we? Julian, why are you so unconcerned about the Boss? You've worked together for five years! You should be the most worried about her!" Maxwell said, his face full of confusion.

Julian's expression turned serious. "She went in willingly. Besides, she has her own strategy. No one is allowed to ruin her plan!"

"Plan? No way! Is it like what she did at the Auto Show? Or that time at the Guci showdown? Does she have a plan to turn the tables?" someone asked.

"Exactly. This time, when her plan succeeds, it will draw blood. Just wait and see," Julian replied.

Everyone there started to feel excited and cheered. "Hurray! The Boss has a plan! This is the best news!"

"Why did the Boss tell you her plans and not us? Does she like you?"

Julian froze. 'Why would she like me?'

He glanced at the luxury cars driving away in the distance, pushed away his inappropriate feelings, and responded indifferently, "You talk too much. Do you want to lose your tongue? Everyone, go home. Don't you dare ruin her plan! If you do, I won't let any of you get away!"

"Yes, yes, yes, the Boss's husband!" the crowd teased as they dispersed.

The scene went unnoticed by the wider world. Meanwhile, the entire internet was still hurling abuse at Isabella, growing more aggressive by the hour. Gabriella even hired someone to release a video. In the video, Isabella could be seen picking up the strawberry. When she thought no one was looking, she sneakily tossed it into a nearby trash can. The internet exploded with fury!

Isabella must have planted the poison. Why else wouldn't she eat the strawberry? Why else would she secretly throw it away? It was unbelievable! Evil-hearted! Scheming b*tch!

Within two days, news of the 12 poisoned models had spread globally. It was inevitable, given the number of famous models involved. Isabella was also a well-known, wealthy female CEO. Her popularity was sky-high. Even people who didn't follow entertainment gossip knew all about it.

Isabella had become a vicious murderer in the public's eyes. Conversely, a video of Victoria defending Isabella also went viral online. As the only one of the 12 models who believed in Isabella, she was hailed as the number one kind-hearted angel.
###Chapter 128

Victoria Kensington hadn't slept properly in days.

The case remained unresolved without Isabella Montgomery's confession.

Without airtight, irrefutable evidence, the loopholes kept the investigation open.

Isabella's refusal to admit guilt left Victoria constantly on edge.

She couldn't shake the fear that Isabella might suddenly turn the tables.

This situation demanded immediate resolution.

Victoria grabbed her phone and texted Isadora Vasquez.

"Handle it now. Pressure the eleven supermodels to escalate the case."

Those supermodels were notoriously arrogant and hot-tempered.

They'd never tolerated newcomers stealing their spotlight.

Failing to crush her now would threaten their future dominance.

They demanded Isabella immediately confess her crimes.

They insisted she sign compensation agreements.

They required public apologies from her.

"That stubborn old fool," Victoria spat out angrily. "He insists he believes Isabella. He won't even discuss it unless she's proven guilty!"

Isadora offered reassurance. "Don't anger yourself. The outcome is inevitable. It's merely a timing issue."

Their conversation ended as the car arrived.

Dozens of fans and reporters swarmed outside the station.

Global media outlets covered the unfolding scandal.

A satisfied smile curled Victoria's lips.

Isadora was correct. Victory was assured.

The situation had exploded beyond control.

Current evidence made reversal nearly impossible for Isabella.

Victoria stepped out of the car.

Reporters immediately surrounded her, shoving microphones forward.

"How much compensation are you seeking?"

"What's the Montgomery family's stance on Isabella's poisoning scandal?"

Victoria had applied makeup to appear exceptionally pale.

She'd subtly reddened her eyes to simulate sleeplessness.

She faced the cameras with a pained expression. "I've stated repeatedly. My sister didn't plant that poison. She isn't that kind of person. She's being framed. Please, let me through. I've hired the best lawyer for her. He'll arrive shortly."

She and Isadora pushed through the crowd together.

Admiring sighs followed them. "All other models are furious, but Victoria alone still believes her. She's too kind-hearted."

"Truly the number one pure-hearted goddess. After all these years, she remains spotless and innocent."

"It's baffling. Both are from the Montgomery family. How did Victoria become so lovely while Isabella turned so wicked?"

Victoria's heart swelled with smug satisfaction at the praise.

Externally, she maintained her mask of concerned kindness.

After today, Isabella would have no escape from her predicament.

Inside the detention room, all eleven supermodels had gathered.

Their assistants and lawyers crowded the space, creating chaos.

Policemen formed a human barricade to prevent physical altercations.

Nearly thirty people pointed accusing fingers at Isabella.

They shouted demands simultaneously. "You evil poisoner! Apologize to us now! Compensate us for lost work and psychological trauma!"

"Admit your guilt! Stop pretending! We know you did it!"

Isabella sat on the bed, leaning against the wall.

Her eyes remained closed in meditation throughout the commotion.

Suddenly, a soft voice cut through the noise. "Everyone, please quiet down. I'm Victoria Kensington. Isabella's older sister. I believe she's innocent. Let me speak..."

Isabella's eyes finally opened.

'The fake bitch has arrived,' she thought. 'The real show begins now.'
###Chapter 129

The moment Victoria appeared, the models surged forward like a tidal wave.

“The evidence is overwhelming! How can anyone still defend her?”

“She must pay for our losses! Ten million per model is non-negotiable!”

“As her sister, make her confess! We’ll sue and get her blacklisted industry-wide!”

Their voices merged into a furious chorus. Victoria’s gaze drifted toward Isabella, her lips pressed into a thin, apologetic line.

“My sister has a point,” she said softly. “The evidence is circumstantial. Traces of poison on her fingers could’ve come from accidental contact.”

Eunice scoffed loudly. “Then explain why she didn’t eat the strawberry! Why throw it away?”

All eyes locked onto Isabella. “Yes! Explain yourself!”

“Why is she the only one with poison residue?”

“Enough talk! She’s just stalling. Let’s sue her now! Boycott all her companies!”

Lawyers were already being summoned, phones pressed to ears as legal threats circulated.

Victoria approached Isabella with feigned concern. “Just compensate them first. We can sort out the truth later.”

“So you endorse extorting ten million from the ‘culprit’?” Isabella’s voice cut through the noise like ice.

Victoria stiffened. The question felt like a trap.

“If you’re responsible,” she said carefully, “compensation is reasonable. These are top models losing millions per day. Ten million is generous.”

Eunice sneered. “Be grateful we’re not demanding more!”

Isabella scanned the room. “You all agree? Ten million each? No regrets?”

“Just pay up!” they shouted in unison.

“You’re lying!” Eunice spat.

Isabella ignored her. She produced a notepad and scrawled a contract: ‘The agreed compensation is $10 million per model, payable upon court verdict.’

She coated her thumb in crimson lipstick and pressed it firmly onto the paper.

“Your turn,” she said, passing the document around.

“Why do we need to sign?” Eunice protested.

Isabella’s smile was razor-sharp. “So you don’t suddenly decide to double the price tomorrow. Press your thumbprints. All of you.”

The models hesitated, unnerved by her commanding presence. She was the accused, yet she held the room in her thrall.
###Chapter 130

Each supermodel had no choice but to comply, pressing their thumbprints onto the document.

The paper reached Victoria last. She hesitated, studying it with suspicion. Her eyes scanned the conditions Isabella had written, sensing something unusual. But since Isabella had agreed to the terms, what could possibly go wrong? Besides, this guarantee letter would be perfect to present to her grandfather…

Victoria steeled herself and pressed her thumb onto the paper. In total, twelve copies of the guarantee letter were made, one for each model. They collected their documents and quickly departed.

Victoria was the final one to exit. She cast a look toward Isabella. "Sister, it's only one hundred ten million. That's not a significant amount for you. Don't be too upset. Besides, if you learn from this and courageously admit your fault, everyone will forgive you. Even if they don't, you're incredibly wealthy. You'll be fine without a career in entertainment."

"You talk too much. Leave now, whether you're finished or not," Isabella retorted, rolling her eyes. She moved to the bed and lay down. Her expression was icy, devoid of any warmth, like a frozen winter lake.

Victoria clenched her fists, her eyes filled with contempt. She thought, 'Isabella is detained and hated by the entire world. How can she still act so arrogantly? I can't wait to see how long her savage attitude lasts!'

Externally, Victoria maintained a concerned facade due to the police presence. "Sister, rest well tonight. I'm leaving now," she said softly before exiting and entering her car.

Inside the vehicle, her sweet demeanor vanished instantly, replaced by a smug, malicious grin. Gabriella drove while asking, "Now that you have this document, will Theodore Senior really revoke Isabella's shares?"

"He has always favored Isabella, so of course he won't. That's why I need you to do something else," Victoria replied, then proceeded to give Gabriella a detailed set of instructions.

That same day, the headline [Isabella Confesses! Guilty As Charged!] trended globally. Genevieve had leaked the guarantee letter to the press, complete with Isabella's thumbprint signature. Since the letter stated Isabella agreed to pay ten million in compensation to each supermodel, even her remaining supporters abandoned her.

The internet exploded with venom and hatred directed at Isabella.

[That monster finally admits her guilt! She's agreed to pay up!]

[She really did poison those twelve models! How vicious! She's a wicked, despicable person!]

[Honestly, what stood out to me was how sweet Victoria is! She's the only one not demanding compensation. From all the video footage, she treats Isabella so well.]

[You're right. I have a feeling she's planning an escape. Why else not pay today?]

[We just have to watch the court proceedings the day after tomorrow. We must ensure this evil woman pays!]

The online abuse was relentless. Meanwhile, the Montgomery family faced their own crisis. Isabella's fifteen percent family shares were part of the Montgomery Group. Her confession triggered a massive plunge in the company's market value. Overnight, share prices hit rock bottom!

Within three days, the Montgomery family shares lost billions in value! The entire family gathered in the main hall, chaos erupting. All the shareholders are outside, demanding you revoke all of Ms. Isabella's shares immediately!"
###Chapter 131

Theodore Montgomery held complete ownership of all shares. He alone determined their distribution among his descendants. Yet ten additional investors held stakes in the Montgomery Group. These individuals were not family. They provided crucial technical expertise and capital. Their agreements guaranteed annual profit-sharing percentages. But they cared nothing for equity control. Their interest began and ended with financial returns.

Decades prior, Theodore had established these terms personally. The Montgomery Group’s very foundation relied on this profit-sharing structure. Their contracts were ironclad. If these investors stirred trouble now, the consequences would be catastrophic. A falling stock price was manageable. Total operational collapse was not. Theodore’s brow furrowed deeply. “Are every single one of them here?”

“All of them, sir,” Reginald Thornton confirmed. “And that is not the worst of it. The entire extended family has arrived as well.” A rising clamor of voices echoed from the hall. Theodore set his prayer book aside. He rose slowly, massaging his stiff knees. He moved toward the door with deliberate steps.

Penelope Sinclair spotted him first. She rushed forward, her expression severe. “Father, that adopted girl confessed everything! Why shield her still? She accused Sophia Kensington of vile intentions. But let’s be clear—Isabella Montgomery is no saint herself!”

“Our family’s losses are monumental because of her!” Gregory Kensington shouted, his face flushed with anger. “She must be removed from the Board immediately! She must return the fifteen percent of shares she holds!”

The chorus of voices swelled in agreement. “Return the shares! Remove her from the Board! Sever all connections with her!”

Theodore’s expression was grave, his voice steady but weary. “Has the investigation concluded? Have the police issued any official statement?”

“She signed a guarantee!” a shareholder yelled. “A written promise to cover all losses within two days!”

The deep lines on Theodore’s face seemed to have multiplied. He appeared to have aged years in just days. Victoria Kensington watched him closely. She moved quickly to his side, offering her arm for support. “Grandfather, I am so sorry. I truly believed my sister was set up. I exhausted every resource trying to help her these past two days. I pleaded with the eleven supermodels. They were utterly inflexible. They forced this guarantee from her…”

Victoria presented the document. Theodore recognized Isabella’s handwriting instantly. He recoiled, stumbling backward. And please, do not fear for Isabella’s future. Her diamond mines remain. She will never want for money. Even after… her release… she will live comfortably.”

We must also protect her from the public’s hatred! So many people despise her now. Their anger could turn violent. We cannot predict what they might do.”

Eleanor Kensington nodded in vigorous agreement. “Father, if you care for her at all, you will take the shares. For her own safety. This mob mentality… it’s dangerous. Someone might harm her if she remains connected to us.”

Theodore’s face darkened further. A profound worry etched itself onto his features. He understood the viperous nature of the crowd before him. If this continued, they would show Isabella no mercy. Their vengeance would be swift and brutal.

A heavy, resigned sigh escaped him. “Very well. Do as you have decided. In two days, I will have Atticus Whitmore, our lawyer, meet with Isabella. He will handle the transfer of her shares.” Having spoken, Theodore turned away. He retreated back toward the quiet solitude of the prayer hall.

Victoria’s brow creased slightly. “Grandfather,” she called after him, “to whom will you transfer Isabella’s shares?”

Theodore paused at the threshold. He did not turn back. “To Richard Montgomery for the time being.” Then he disappeared inside, closing the heavy door firmly behind him.

A surge of pure triumph shot through Victoria. Richard Montgomery’s other children were perpetual disappointments. She was his sole favored daughter. Once those shares were in his possession, they would inevitably find their way to her. It was only a matter of time.

She allowed herself a small, victorious smile before schooling her features into concern. She addressed the closed door with honeyed sweetness. “A wise decision, Grandfather. Please, you must rest now. Do not let this trouble your heart. Isabella will be fine. Her diamond mines ensure she will never be poor.”

Theodore ignored the fading noises from the hall. He waited until silence prevailed. Then he crossed to a seemingly solid wall. His fingers found a hidden button, pressing it precisely. A section of the wall slid open noiselessly, revealing a concealed compartment. Inside rested a single, ornate picture frame. The name inscribed upon it was not Montgomery.
###Chapter 132

Nathaniel smiled reassuringly. “Don’t worry, there are no wolves or tigers at the estate. Oliver has prepared a gift to celebrate your release. These past couple of days, he’s had no appetite and trouble sleeping. He misses you terribly.”

Hearing that, Isabella found it impossible to refuse.

“Fine,” she relented. “Once I’m out, I’ll make time to visit.”

Outside, Oliver leaped for joy. “Yes! Mommy is coming to our home as a guest! Daddy and Mommy can spend time together!”

Isabella heard a noise from outside. She frowned. “What was that? It sounds like someone’s out there.”

“No, it’s probably just… a mouse,” Nathaniel said quickly, glancing toward the door. He changed the subject. “Isabella, tomorrow is crucial. If you need any help, just ask.”

Tomorrow was the hearing date for her case.

The matter would finally be settled.

Everyone was waiting to see Isabella sentenced to prison.

All eleven models were anticipating the moment she would publicly apologize and pay them the promised compensation.

Reporters and netizens would flock to the courthouse to livestream the proceedings.

The slightest misstep could lead to severe consequences.

Yet Isabella continued eating the meal Oliver had prepared with apparent ease. “Relax,” she said. “My team can handle this small matter.”

‘Small matter…’ Nathaniel thought, bewildered.

Seeing her confidence, he decided not to press further. “Enjoy your food and get some rest tonight,” he said. “I’ll head back to help Momo prepare your gifts.”

His tone was calm and elegant, even though he was fussing over her a little.

Isabella watched him leave, a strange feeling stirring in her heart.

She could see he genuinely cared about her and wanted to see her again.

Over the past few days in detention, he had been the person she saw the most.

If only what happened five years ago hadn’t occurred… If that bastard hadn’t…

Just then, she thought she heard a faint voice from outside her room. “Daddy! You’re amazing!”
###Chapter 134

That voice…

It sounded so much like Oliver’s.

But he should be at home right now, preparing for my release. He should be too worried to sleep or eat. Maybe I’m just hearing things…

Isabella Montgomery shook her head slightly.

She cleaned up the area after finishing her meal. It was late. She didn’t expect any more visitors tonight.

Click. Clack. Click. Clack.

The sharp sound of high heels echoed down the hall. Each step was confident and aggressive. It revealed the wearer’s strong personality.

The door swung open.

Isabella looked up.

A woman stood in the doorway. She wore a deep burgundy dress suit. Her hair was a mass of voluminous curls. She exuded an air of power and competence.

It was Genevieve Beaumont.

Isabella gave her a quick glance. Then she turned away, completely ignoring her.

Genevieve stepped inside and shut the door. Her eyes swept the room with obvious disdain.

“I never thought the famous diamond boss would end up in a place like this,” she said coldly. “I warned you. The entertainment industry isn’t as simple as you believed.”

“You made a fortune in business. But here, without guidance, you’re easily crushed.”

Isabella acted as if she heard nothing. She carefully washed the fine food container. Then she dried her hands with a tissue.

Genevieve was irritated by her arrogance. She forced herself to stay calm.

“Isabella, honestly, I admire you,” she said, changing her tone. “Your ability to turn situations around has always impressed me. Sign with me. I can solve all your current problems. I guarantee you’ll become a top star in Westchester. What do you say?”

Isabella tossed the tissue away. She walked to the bed and sat down. She leaned back against the headboard lazily. Her expression was cool and detached. She radiated an aloof, uninterested energy.

Genevieve finally lost her patience.

“Isabella! I’m talking to you!” she snapped. “Are you even listening? You’re at rock bottom. I came here to help you. How dare you be so disrespectful!”

“Let me make this clear. No one else can save you but me. Signing with me is your only chance!”

“Huh?” Isabella raised an eyebrow. She looked directly at Genevieve. “Who are you?”

Who are you?

The question was like a slap.

Genevieve was stunned. She had just spent all that time pitching her offer. And Isabella didn’t even know who she was?

She was furious. She felt her blood pressure rising.

They had spoken on the phone before. Isabella had been dismissive then. But this was worse. This was a direct insult.

Genevieve was the PR Queen. Everyone in the industry knew her. How could Isabella not recognize her?

She was doing this on purpose.

Genevieve gritted her teeth.

“Isabella, what gives you the right to refuse me?” she hissed. “Do you not realize you’re being sentenced tomorrow? You’ll have to pay massive compensations. Have you thought about how you’ll live the rest of your life?”

“If you sign with me, you’ll be SilverPeak’s top star. You’ll not only be cleared of all charges, but you’ll also be famous across the city. If you choose to stay stubborn and ignorant, you’ll rot in jail!”

“The air in jail is probably hundreds of times fresher than at your SilverPeak Entertainment,” Isabella replied coolly. “Has no one ever told you that your breath stinks?”

She shot Genevieve a look of disgust. Then she scooted closer to the wall.

Genevieve was enraged. Her face twisted. Her hands clenched into fists.

“Isabella! I’m asking you one last time!” she yelled. “Will you be a fool, or will you sign with me? Don’t forget—in everyone’s eyes, you’re finished!”

“Your bad breath is truly extreme,” Isabella said calmly. “Here. Have one of these.”

She picked up a strip of chewing gum from beside her pillow. In one swift, sharp motion, she flung it directly at Genevieve.

Genevieve tried to dodge, but she was too slow.

The gum shot straight into her mouth. She choked and gagged.

“Ugh!” She frantically pulled the gum out. She glared at Isabella with pure hatred. “Isabella! Just you wait! I look forward to seeing how pathetic you are tomorrow!”

She turned on her heel and stormed out. The loud click-clack of her heels echoed through the detention center.

Outside the police station, Genevieve made a call.

“Get me ten influencers for tomorrow,” she ordered coldly. “Prepare them to livestream the hearing. Also, get me these things. I’ll make sure Isabella Montgomery never recovers from this.”
###Chapter 135

The courthouse was surrounded by a massive crowd before dawn even broke.

Clustered nearest the iron gates stood eleven supermodels, all waiting for their settlement checks.

They were also there to witness Isabella Montgomery's sentencing with their own eyes.

Victoria Kensington stood among them, clutching Gabriella Martinez's hand.

The Montgomery family lawyer, Atticus Whitmore, followed close behind them.

They were fully prepared to force Isabella to sign the share transfer documents.

Victoria secretly texted Alexander Whitmore, her heart swelling with triumph.

(Alexander my love, you can rest easy now. After today, those shares belong to us. You won't have to endure the humiliation of courting my sister any longer.)

Alexander was currently lounging on his sofa, swirling a glass of red wine.

His television was tuned to a live stream hosted by a popular internet celebrity.

A nagging doubt plagued him. 'With Nathaniel Blackwood's immense power and resources, would he truly allow Isabella to be imprisoned?'

'But how could even he save her now? The evidence against her is overwhelming. She has completely sealed her own fate.'

'To think Isabella was capable of such a vicious act. She dug her own grave. Who would want her after she gets out of prison in a few years?'

'I can't wait to see her arrogance finally shattered. Victoria is truly the kind and gentle one,' he mused.

He quickly typed a reply.

[My little angel, this is the final day. Ensure there are no mistakes. I will reward you handsomely tonight once our plan succeeds.]

Victoria read the message, a blissful smile gracing her lips.

Reporters suddenly swarmed her, shoving microphones in her face.

"Ms. Victoria, as Isabella's sister, what are your thoughts today? Do you have a message for the public?"

She hastily pocketed her phone, adopting a sorrowful expression.

"Even now, I find it hard to believe my sister is capable of such actions. I feel this must be a terrible misunderstanding."

"Perhaps the court will prove her innocence today! I will hold onto hope until the very last moment."

The crowd was moved by her words, gazing at her with admiration and respect.

Victoria truly embodied the nation's sweetheart, her heart seemingly pure and compassionate.

Dozens of internet celebrities and influencers had also arrived, capitalizing on the event.

They were all conducting live broadcasts, hyping up the spectacle for their audiences.

In a nearby secluded alley, a sleek black Maybach sat idling.

Nathaniel Blackwood and Oliver were in the back seat, while Sebastian was behind the wheel.

Oliver fidgeted nervously with a toy in his hands.

"Daddy! All the top streamers are here. Thirty-nine of them are live right now."

"The main broadcast channel already has over forty-three million viewers!"

Forty-three million. The number echoed in Nathaniel's mind.

That was equivalent to the viewership of major New Year's Eve specials.

A single misstep today would haunt her forever in the public eye.

He frowned, his voice tense. "Sebastian, any update on Julian Hawthorne's movements? Are his preparations secure?"

"Julian..." Sebastian sighed heavily. "He's been completely absorbed with his new agency, GoldenPhoenix Entertainment."

"He's been negotiating contracts for new artists all week. It doesn't appear he plans to come today."

Nathaniel's frown deepened. 'So Eric isn't the one assisting her? Perhaps it's Harrison Winslow? But Harrison is preoccupied with other matters.'

Despite Isabella's assurances, a deep unease settled in his gut.

"Prepare all necessary contingencies. Be ready to adapt to any situation immediately!" he ordered sharply.

"Understood!" Sebastian and Oliver responded in unison. Sebastian gave a firm nod.

Oliver's clear, childish voice rang with determination.

As the appointed hour approached, footsteps finally echoed from the end of the passageway.

"She's here! She's here!" a voice shouted loudly.

Instantly, every head turned toward the sound. All eyes focused on the approaching figure.
###Chapter 136

Isabella Montgomery approached with a police escort.

Her beige cotton dress appeared deceptively simple. The minimalist design radiated an intellectual elegance reminiscent of classical scholars.

At five-foot-seven, she towered over most spectators even in flat shoes.

Her gaze remained fixed ahead with detached composure. She moved with the unbothered grace of someone strolling through private gardens. Her demeanor showed no trace of impending legal judgment.

The crowd stirred at her arrival. Influencers aimed their phones while reporters snapped photographs.

Microphones thrust toward her as questions erupted.

"Isabella! Explain why you poisoned twelve top models! Was this some petty dispute?"

"Are you aware of the diplomatic implications? As a Diamond Boss and wealthiest woman, why model such terrible behavior?"

"Don't you owe the world an apology? Don't you have anything to say?"

Isabella ignored them completely. She treated the shouting crowd as insignificant background noise.

The officers flanking her into the courthouse seemed more like personal security. She commanded attention like a celebrity making a red carpet appearance.

Victoria Kensington clenched her fists. Envy burned through her.

She had expected to see Isabella disgraced and broken. Instead, Isabella maintained her arrogant composure. How could someone facing conviction still radiate such superiority?

Business first.

She turned to Atticus Whitmore. "Must we have her sign the equity transfer today?"

Atticus stood beside Victoria, reminded of their objective. "Absolutely."

He stepped forward with documents. "Ms. Montgomery. The Director requires your signature on the equity transfer agreement today. My schedule is tight. Sign it now."

He thrust the paperwork toward her.

The models surged forward with demands.

"I have appointments later! Return my money immediately!"

"Watching your trial wastes my time! I only care about getting paid!"

"You signed the agreement! No more delays!"

"Apologize and pay us! I want to leave this disgusting place! I can't stand being near a criminal like you!"

They pressed around her like vultures circling carrion. Everyone treated her like contaminated garbage.

Isabella stayed silent. She checked her watch impatiently.

Eight minutes until ten. Couldn't they have arrived earlier?

The crowd grew more aggressive seeing her indifference.

Fans of the eleven models brandished rotten vegetables ready to throw.

One officer raised his voice. "Remain calm everyone! The court hasn't issued any ruling! Be rational!"

Nearby, Genevieve Beaumont watched from her car with a frown.

Days of court sessions had yielded no conviction due to lack of concrete evidence.

Isabella's assault last night still stung her mouth. She wanted Isabella destroyed completely.

She retrieved her phone and sent an anonymous video to Isadora Vasquez.

This video guaranteed conviction! She would finish Isabella through Isadora's hands!
###Chapter 137

Isabella Montgomery observed the unfolding chaos beside Victoria Kensington when a new email notification flashed on her screen.

She tapped it open immediately.

The video attachment loaded instantly.

Isabella subtly tugged at Victoria’s sleeve.

Noticing everyone was preoccupied with condemning Isabella, Victoria discreetly glanced at the email.

Who could have sent this? Who was pulling the strings behind the scenes?

Clearly, she wasn’t the only one who wanted Isabella destroyed.

As long as Isabella faced conviction, the sender’s identity didn’t matter.

Isadora Vasquez stepped forward. “Everyone, quiet! An anonymous source just sent me a video. They claim it’s definitive proof!”

She raised her phone high, pressing play.

It was clearly filmed by a staff member at close range. The quality was far superior to the grainy CCTV footage.

It dusted the strawberries beneath. The evidence was undeniable.

“This is it! She’s guilty!”
“Isabella Montgomery! Confess! You’re caught red-handed!”

Eleanor Kensington wrapped a comforting arm around her. “Victoria, my dear, don’t upset yourself. I always warned you about her true nature. Sever all ties. She will only drag you down with her.”

“Pay the compensation! Admit your guilt!”
“Sign the equity transfer! Stop disgracing the Montgomery name!”

The mob closed in, their faces twisted with contempt.

“I have evidence to present!”

It was Maxwell Carter, dragging a frightened man toward the crowd.

Confused murmurs rippled through the onlookers. Who were these men?

Isadora’s face paled upon recognizing the man being dragged.

###Chapter 138

The man looked truly menacing.

A long, jagged scar ran down the side of his face.

Despite his intimidating appearance, he had been completely subdued by Maxwell.

One look at Maxwell was enough to fill him with pure terror.

Victoria Kensington's face drained of all color.

Every pair of eyes in the room instantly snapped toward her.

Shocked murmurs rippled through the crowd.

"Victoria? Impossible! She's always been so supportive of Isabella!"

"She's the kindest person I know. There's no way she'd purchase something like that."

"This man is clearly a criminal. He could have been paid off, right?"

"Absolutely! It has to be Isabella! She's trying to clear her name by framing Victoria!"

Eleanor Kensington, ever Victoria's fierce defender, shouted at the scarred man. "Who paid you to lie about my daughter? Victoria would never do such a thing!"

Victoria snapped out of her daze, quickly adopting a mask of pitiful innocence. She addressed the man with a soft, trembling voice. "Sir, you must be mistaken. You do know that perjury is a serious crime, don't you? Are you in some kind of trouble? Facing difficulties? Tell me how much money you need. I can give you more. I can help you solve any problem. But please, don't... don't frame me for this."

Her words, though gentle on the surface, were a blatant attempt at bribery. She was offering more money to buy his silence.

Silas felt a pang of sympathy for the beautiful, distressed girl. But one thought of how Maxwell had dragged him here made him shudder violently. "I'm not in trouble! I'm not facing any hardships! And I'm not lying! I have proof!"

He fumbled for his phone, holding it up high for everyone to see. "This is surveillance footage from my security cameras! Everyone, watch closely!"

All attention focused on the screen. The video was crystal clear.

The footage showed a dimly lit basement. A woman clad entirely in black, a mask obscuring part of her face, was handing a stack of cash to the scarred man. In return, he handed her a small medicine bottle.

The woman was unmistakably Isadora Vasquez. Her height, her hair tied back in a simple ponytail, even the partially visible profile—it was all a perfect match.

A second video played. It showed Isadora walking backstage at the Mercedes Auto show, carrying a box of water bottles. She distributed them to the crew. Everyone thanked her. She even kindly helped arrange the strawberries on the display. Then, when no one was looking, she discreetly poured the contents of the medicine bottle over the strawberry tower.

The evidence was undeniable.

The atmosphere in the room erupted.

"It was Isadora! She works for Victoria!"

"Oh my god! I can't believe it! Victoria had her buy the drug and frame Isabella!"

"She pretended to be Isabella's biggest supporter. She acted so genuine, so nice! All this time, she was pure evil!"

"She's a master of deception! She played every single one of us for fools!"

"We should have realized. That drug is only stable in liquid form. The video Victoria showed earlier had to be a fake! It was fabricated!"

"Not only did they frame Isabella, but they also manufactured evidence to ensure her conviction!"

A wave of angry accusations crashed over Victoria. The crowd stared at her with undisguised contempt and disgust.

Reporters raised their cameras, flashes popping incessantly. Influencers pointed their phones directly at her, broadcasting the scandal live to their audiences.

Even Eleanor, who had defended her so fiercely, looked at Victoria with utter disbelief. "Victoria," she asked, her voice shaking. "What is the meaning of this?"

This was the daughter she trusted and cherished above all others. Could she truly be capable of such monstrous deceit?

Victoria stood frozen, her face a ghostly white.

How could this be happening?

Isadora had assured her everything was handled. How could this damning evidence still exist?
###Chapter 139

Her anxiety spiked to unprecedented levels.

Yet she maintained that pitiful mask perfectly.

"It's fabricated," Victoria whispered hoarsely. "This video is completely fake. Someone engineered this to destroy me. I would never harm my own sister like this."

One of Victoria's loyal friends quickly rallied. "Exactly! If Gabriella's footage was manipulated, this could be too!"

Eleanor snapped out of her stunned silence.

She immediately moved to shield Victoria, her body a protective barrier.

She fixed a furious glare on Silas. "Who paid you to create these lies? Why are you targeting my daughter? I raised Victoria myself! She is incapable of such monstrous acts!"

Her defense was fierce, unwavering.

Isabella watched from the sidelines, a cold, knowing smile touching her lips.

The stark contrast was not lost on her.

Had she been the one accused, Eleanor's hand would have already struck her face.

But for Victoria? Only fierce protection.

Eleanor was about to learn the brutal truth about her precious, perfect daughter.

Isabella's gaze shifted back to Silas, her voice cutting through the tension. "Your credibility is being questioned. Presenting forged evidence in a court of law carries a sentence of up to three years."

Three years in prison.

Silas's legs nearly buckled beneath him.

He was already a wanted man, cooperating with Maxwell for a chance at leniency.

He turned desperately to the lead officer. "I swear on my life this video is authentic! If there's a single fabricated frame, sentence me to death! Verify it yourselves! Go to the black market! Retrieve the hidden security footage! You'll find Miss Martinez clear as day there!"

His eyes darted wildly between Victoria and Gabriella. "Only black market insiders know about that camera. It can't be tampered with! It can't be erased! Nothing escapes its lens!"

Gabriella's face drained of all color.

She had been so careful to avoid all visible cameras that night.

The existence of a hidden one was a catastrophic oversight.

This could ruin her completely.

The lead officer immediately dispatched a team to investigate, forcing a terrified Silas to guide them.

If his claim was verified, she was finished.

A frantic calculation sparked in Victoria's eyes.

Suddenly.

Slap!

A sharp crack echoed as her palm connected brutally with Gabriella's cheek.

"How could you!" Victoria cried out, her voice laced with manufactured agony. "Gabriella! Why would you frame my sister? I treated you like family! Like my own blood! How could you commit such an evil act against her!"

The force of the blow sent Gabriella stumbling to the floor.

A trickle of blood seeped from the corner of her mouth.

She was dazed, struggling to process the sudden betrayal.

The realization dawned cold and hard.

Victoria was sacrificing her.

Of course. Victoria's career, her future, couldn't be tarnished.

She was the top model. She had to remain pristine.

Gabriella remained on the cold floor, sobs beginning to wrack her body.

–

"It's my fault," she wept, the words catching in her throat. "I was blind with rage. I couldn't stand watching Isabella constantly overshadow you. You were always so kind to her, and she repaid you with nothing but schemes. I just... I just wanted to get revenge for you!"

"Unbelievable!" Victoria shrieked, her performance flawless.

She dropped to her knees, grabbing Gabriella's collar and shaking her violently. "I told you! The Guci editorial had nothing to do with Isabella! It was my own failure! I don't blame her! How could you do this! I trusted you like an aunt! Like an older sister! I gave you everything! How could you betray me with such viciousness behind my back? How could you!"
###Chapter 140

Victoria’s voice grew raspy from sobbing.

Tears streamed down her cheeks without pause.

Her delicate frame trembled violently, as if she might collapse from the emotional turmoil.

Some found the entire situation unspeakably messy.

No.

Isabella had a copy of her chats with Gabriella!

This… This was catastrophic!

This would utterly destroy her!
###Chapter 141

Victoria’s entire body went rigid.

She held family shares, but they were untouchable. Liquidating them was impossible.

Paying 110 million dollars would completely wipe out her entire savings. She would be left with nothing.

###Chapter 142

"You demanded my fifteen percent shares for allegedly harming others. By that logic, you should surrender at least ten percent of yours for allowing your agent to commit these crimes."

Ten percent of her shares.

How could Isabella be so ruthless.

Isabella's phone was on speaker. Everyone heard Theodore's command perfectly.

He approached Victoria with the equity transfer agreement. "Ms. Victoria, please comply with the Director's instructions and sign here."

Victoria trembled with rage. Her face was deathly pale.

Twenty billion dollars. Her twenty billion dollars was vanishing just like that.

She came here to seize Isabella's fifteen percent, and now she was losing ten percent of her own.

She was on the verge of a complete breakdown. But cameras were pointed at her from every direction. The situation had spiraled out of control. What choice did she have? How could she refuse?

She had no option. She gritted her teeth and forced out the words. "Of course... I should do this after causing Isabella so much distress... I will treat her better from now on. I will make it up to her!"

Her hand shook violently as she signed her name on the document.

Atticus brought the agreement to Isabella for her signature.

Ten percent of the shares, with a market value of two hundred billion dollars, now belonged to Isabella.

Victoria's body trembled so uncontrollably she almost collapsed.

Eleanor caught her. "Victoria, let's go. We'll give your statement, then go home and speak to grandfather about this! Isabella, you went too far today. You've disappointed me. You've broken my heart!"

With that, Eleanor led a distraught Victoria away from the scene.

Isabella watched them leave, her expression turning frosty.

Disappointed? Heartbroken?

She felt the exact same way.

She pushed through the crowd. Maxwell handed her the keys to the Kawasaki. She mounted the bike and sped away.
###Chapter 143

Twitter exploded within the hour.

#IsabellaIsInnocent, #GabriellaGets3Years, #VictoriaPays110Billion, and #VictoriaIsRottenInside dominated the trending list.

Gabriella Martinez pleaded guilty immediately. The evidence was overwhelming. Isabella Montgomery had executed a flawless victory.

The internet turned into a frenzy of condemnation. Victoria Kensington became the primary target.

Isabella had won decisively.

No one had ever shielded Isabella like that.

Hard work never earned her such fierce, blind loyalty.

The sun was brutal. The wind felt cold and harsh.

He towered over her, his shoulders broad and imposing.

She remembered. She hadn't expected him to retrieve her personally.

She was free today.

She compartmentalized her pain. The helmet went on. She mounted the bike.

A woman on a powerful motorcycle drew attention. Especially one in light-colored gear.

Mr. Blackwood. The man who owned Shelburne.

The racer swerved violently, fleeing the scene. His gang scattered behind him.
###Chapter 144

This was what it felt like to be truly protected.

The Palace Heart was an exclusive gated community of luxury villas. Each villa spanned nineteen floors, featuring sprawling pastures, Olympic-sized swimming pools, private golf courses, and meticulously curated man-made gardens. The price tag for a single villa hovered around ten digits.

Only the elite could afford such opulence.

Servants pushed the heavy, ornate doors open for them. A breathtakingly magnificent hall was revealed.

The entire space was lavishly adorned with countless pink roses. The villa appeared to be completely overtaken by a sea of blossoms. Helium balloons floated gracefully near the vaulted ceilings. It felt like stepping into a dreamlike fairy tale.

Isabella was momentarily stunned by the elaborate decor.

"Please, Ms. Montgomery," Nathaniel said respectfully.

He had been leading but suddenly shifted to walk behind her. Isabella had no choice but to step forward.

His childish voice rang out clearly as he pulled the string on a confetti popper he held.

A shower of colorful ribbons and gold foil flakes rained down upon Isabella.

Standing there, enveloped in the celebration, she felt a surreal grandeur, almost like a wedding ceremony.

She had never experienced such thoughtful treatment since childhood...

Oliver rushed forward, grabbing Isabella's hand. "Mommy, I want a hug! I missed you so, so much!"

"It's only been a few days," Isabella smiled warmly. She bent down and scooped the chubby boy into her arms.

For some inexplicable reason, even though he wasn't her biological child, holding him filled her with a profound sense of maternal love and fulfillment.

Forever…

The word caused Isabella's gaze to darken instantly.

Could there ever be a 'forever' with Nathaniel and Oliver?

Probably not. Their fate had been sealed by that incident five years ago...

"Oh! Right! Here it is!"

Oliver wriggled out of Isabella's arms and darted back to the flower arrangement. He retrieved a pristine white gift box and presented it to her.

A gift? Custom-made for her?

Isabella had thought the stunning decorations were gift enough. Deeply touched, she accepted the box and carefully opened it.

Dozens of vibrant butterflies instantly fluttered out, creating a magical, dreamlike spectacle. And inside the box, revealed amongst the soft lining, was...
###Chapter 145

Nathaniel designed it.

Using Oliver was a clever tactic.

Violinists. Candlelight. Steak.

Oliver wore a t-shirt with cartoon cats, looking adorable.
Nathaniel was in relaxed loungewear, a light gray shirt.
He looked effortlessly elegant.
###Chapter 146

A vast five-hundred-square-meter open-air terrace had been transformed into a serene lotus pond.

###Chapter 147

A home.

It wasn’t the first time he’d expressed his feelings. Letting this continue was dangerous.

“I’m being serious, Nathaniel.”

Nathaniel’s posture snapped to attention. “What happened?”

###Chapter 148

"Hot water. A towel. And the mouth guard. Now."

Ten more minutes of this suffering. For a child so small.

###Chapter 149

Not waking up.

###Chapter 150

She handed a sandwich to Oliver. "Let's eat together."

They chatted happily during the short drive. Soon, the grand gates of the Montgomery Manor came into view.

"Just stop here," Isabella said. "I'll walk the rest of the way."

Nathaniel understood she wanted to keep his involvement private. He didn't argue, pulling the car over.

Oliver's cheerful mood vanished. He clung to her arm. "Mommy, you have to come back! Don't forget me!"

"Don't worry. We pinky swore, remember? I'll find you as soon as I'm done." She gave his hair one last ruffle and stepped out.

As she passed the driver's side, Nathaniel rolled down the window. His voice was a deep, steady reassurance. "Call me if you need anything."

Lately, her heart did a strange, heavy thump whenever she looked at him. She pushed the feeling aside. "Don't worry. I can handle the small problems, at least." She turned and walked toward the manor with confident strides.

Nathaniel watched her go, a slight frown forming. Sometimes, he wished she was just an ordinary woman...

Inside the Montgomery Manor's grand hall, the entire family was gathered.

Eleanor was wailing dramatically. "Dad, this truly wasn't Victoria's fault! Gabriella was the one sentenced to jail! How could you give ten percent of Victoria's shares to an outsider like Isabella?"

"I object as well!" Frederick protested. "Isabella now holds twenty-five percent! That's more than my wife and me combined. It's completely unfair!"

The room erupted in noisy agreement. They didn't care about Victoria's guilt. They only cared that valuable shares were in the hands of an outsider.

William sat with his eyes closed, listening to the chaos. After a moment, he opened them. "Are you all finished? Are you attempting to rebel against me now?" Though his voice was soft, his age and authority made it ring with undeniable power. The room fell silent.
###Chapter 153

Victoria’s sudden move caught everyone by surprise. She tried to backtrack quickly. “Father, why would we ever fight you? All we want is what’s best for the family. Handing over most of our family shares to an outsider… it just doesn’t make sense.”

“That’s right,” Gregory chimed in, frustration clear in his tone. “Even if Victoria was somehow involved… taking her shares is one thing. But why give them to Isabella? She isn’t one of us.”

William’s eyes hardened. “How many times must I say it? Isabella grew up in this house. She lost her parents—we are her family. She is not an outsider!

“Since she returned from Africa, has she brought any disgrace to this family? Look at what Victoria has done! Anyone with half a brain can see the truth!”

Victoria’s face went pale. The old man clearly didn’t trust her at all. She quickly put on a pitiful expression and weakly stepped toward him. “Grandfather, I know you suspect me, but I am innocent. I would never hurt my sister. Gabriella did everything, I swear to heaven. I would never—”

“Enough.” William’s voice cut like ice. “You might fool a child with that act, but not me. I am neither a fool nor an idiot!” He struck his cane hard against the floor, silencing her.

Victoria’s face lost even more color. She had gathered everyone here today hoping to reclaim her ten percent share, but the old man was being impossibly stubborn.

Why did he favor an adopted child so much? Over the past five years, she had contributed so much to the family. She brought them honor, bought expensive gifts. Ten percent was a fortune… and it was going to Isabella?

No. She would get it back, no matter what it took. Her eyes burned with fierce determination, though she masked it behind a veil of tears.

“If Grandfather doesn’t believe me, and no one here does either… then fine. Assume I did it. Assume I am guilty of everything. I’ll give my life to make up for it! Mother, Father, thank you for raising me. I’ll repay you in my next life.” With that, she lunged toward the wall, aiming to smash her head against it.

Screams erupted. Eleanor instinctively rushed forward and grabbed her. “Victoria, don’t be foolish! Stop this! I can’t lose you!”

“Let me die, Mother! Everyone suspects me! My fans hate me, my own family turns on me…” Victoria sobbed, tears streaming convincingly down her cheeks. Her voice grew hoarse. “It’s my fault for not guiding Gabriella properly. I deserve this punishment!”

Eleanor’s heart shattered. But just as she opened her mouth to plead—

“Let her hit the wall. Let’s see if she actually does it.”

A cold, clear voice cut through the chaos. Everyone turned.

Isabella strode into the hall. She wore a smoke-gray gradient tube dress with bold crimson floral patterns. A phoenix was embroidered across her chest, radiating elegance and power.

Victoria’s eyes narrowed instantly. Why was this bitch here? Dressed so boldly, so fearlessly, while she was at her lowest? And now Isabella might actually make her go through with it!

Eleanor was furious. “What did you just say, Isabella?! Victoria is your sister! She always protected you since you were little! How can you be so cruel? Are you even human?”
###Chapter 154

“What?”

Care? Protection?

Victoria had encouraged laziness since childhood, ensuring Isabella would never amount to anything. She pushed for outrageous fashion choices, praising cheap and tasteless outfits. Victoria systematically molded her into the family’s black sheep. Was this the care William spoke of?

Isabella remained utterly unfazed. “Who’s the real monster here? Who harmed countless people just to get to me, then played the innocent victim? Victoria Kensington, you should be an actress, not a model.”

“Your performance is Oscar-worthy. Should I record this and post it online? You’d go viral.”

Victoria’s face tightened. Isabella was cornering her! The sheer audacity!

She masked her rage with a wounded expression. “Isabella, what will make you believe me? If Mother hadn’t stopped me, I would have died crashing into that wall. But she was right. What would happen to her if I died? She raised me all these years. I can’t let her suffer that loss.”

“I’ll swear it, okay? I swear to God: If I had any part in this, may my parents disown and despise me. May I die a lonely, abandoned orphan!” Victoria vowed, pouring every ounce of fake sincerity into her trembling voice.

The room fell silent. The oath was brutal. Pity for her apparent anguish filled the air. Even William’s stern gaze softened slightly. Had he misjudged her?

Isabella watched the theatrics with cold amusement. A cruel vow? She was already an orphan her real parents never wanted.

Victoria continued her lament, playing the misunderstood, unloved daughter.

‘If she loves acting so much, I’ll give her a standing ovation,’ Isabella thought, a sharp smile playing on her lips. “I might have believed you. Sadly, I have proof.” She flung a stack of photos at Victoria.

The images were from the Mercedes Auto Show backstage. One captured a knowing glance between Victoria and Isadora. Another showed Victoria’s venomous stare directed at her agent. A third clearly displayed a money transfer from Victoria to Isadora.

The amount was $19,500. The exact price Silas the dealer quoted for the halophilic bacteria. The transaction date matched Isadora’s court testimony perfectly.

Shocked gasps echoed through the room. Disbelief was etched on every face.

“My God! How could Victoria be so wicked?”

“The evidence is undeniable. She’s clearly involved.”

“What did Isabella ever do to deserve such hatred? She looks murderous!”

“Heavens! And she put on that whole show! Smashing her head! That horrible vow! Unbelievable!”

“This is terrifying! I always thought she was so kind. But look at her in these photos… She’s a monster!”

The room erupted into chaos. Eleanor, who had been holding Victoria, slowly pulled her hand away. Her voice shook. “Victoria… What is this?”
###Chapter 155

Victoria’s face drained of all color.
She never imagined Isabella would obtain the backstage CCTV footage.
Those printed photos were her complete undoing.
She knew everything would collapse once her family saw this evidence.

Panic set in immediately.
“Mother, you must believe me!” she pleaded frantically.
“Please, trust me! I was only practicing poses for the upcoming show!
The exhibition required dramatic angles and expressions—I was just getting into character!

“As for the transaction record… Isadora told me she needed financial help.
I transferred the money without knowing what it was for!”

Her excuses sounded ludicrous.
No reasonable person would believe such a flimsy story.
Even if Isadora had wanted to borrow money, she would’ve asked for a round number—like 20,000.
Not the suspiciously exact sum of 19,500, which matched the price of the halophilic bacteria.

Eleanor’s mind spun into disarray.
For the first time, she felt genuine doubt toward Victoria.
Was the daughter she thought she knew hiding a sinister side?
Did she truly understand the woman standing before her?

William’s gaze hardened as he stared at the photos.
“Guards!” he commanded. “Take Victoria to the prayer hall.
She will kneel in reflection for three days and three nights.
No food. No water. No visitors.”

Three days of kneeling? No sustenance?
Victoria’s legs gave out beneath her.
Without Eleanor’s support, she crumpled to the floor.
She had never faced punishment like this before.

If word got out that she was confined to the prayer hall, she would become a social pariah.
Her reputation would be ruined forever.
Terror seized her. She clutched Eleanor’s arm desperately.
“Mother, please! Help me! You know this isn’t me!
You raised me—you know I would never harm my sister!

“This is Isabella’s doing! She’s jealous of the attention you give me!
She manipulated these images to destroy me!”

Eleanor’s frown deepened.
She studied the photos again, and a cold dread settled in her chest.
These weren’t trick angles.
The malice in Victoria’s expression was real.
It was terrifying.

She had always believed Victoria was gentle and kind.
How could she possess such darkness?

Heart heavy, Eleanor sighed. “Perhaps some time alone will do you good, Victoria.
I need time to think as well.”

Victoria’s grip slackened.
She collapsed fully onto the ground, defeated.
It was over. Even her mother had turned against her.

Maids approached to escort her away.
No one spoke in her defense.
Not even William, who usually doted on her—his face was stern and contemplative.

Victoria knew she had lost.
There would be no mercy this time.

“If I must go, then I will accept my punishment.
Grandfather, Father, Mother… please take care these next few days.
Don’t worry about me. This is my fault.”

She knelt and knocked her forehead hard against the floor.
A red mark immediately bloomed on her skin.
She didn’t flinch.
Tears streamed silently as the maids led her away.
Her slight frame trembled with each step.

Eleanor’s heart broke watching her leave.
Victoria had always been her favorite.
She had never disciplined her so harshly before.
But maybe it wasn’t too late to correct her.
As a mother, she had to try.

William released a heavy sigh.
“Everyone is dismissed. What happened today does not leave this room.”

The crowd had come hoping to reclaim the ten percent shares.
Now it was clear that wouldn’t happen.
They left in quiet disappointment.

As Eleanor passed Isabella near the doorway, she remembered Isabella’s words from the day before:
‘You always defend Victoria. You always take her side. But when have you ever listened to me?’
###Chapter 156

Isabella remembered Eleanor's words from yesterday.
She recalled the loneliness in Eleanor's eyes.
It made her pause and reconsider.

She turned back to face Isabella directly.
"Would you like to stay for lunch today?"

Stay for lunch...
This was the first gentle invitation since Africa.

Isabella considered her own plans.
She nodded. "I'd like that."

Eleanor called out immediately.
"Aunt Judy, prepare lunch for us."

Aunt Judy hurried off to the kitchen.
The entire household staff suddenly became active.

It was Isabella's first meal here in five years.
But not everyone seemed pleased.

People like Frederick remained distant.
Tiffany's mistake didn't erase their suspicions.

To them, Isabella was still the outsider.
The one who took twenty-five percent of the family shares.

They dispersed without acknowledging her.
Isabella didn't seem to care either.

She spent time talking with Theodore.
They spoke for quite a while before he left for business.

Then Isabella headed toward the prayer hall.
She wouldn't miss seeing Victoria's punishment.

As she walked down the hallway, a figure appeared.
It was Alexander.

Dressed in his usual black suit.
The successful, handsome businessman.

Isabella frowned.
Why was he here at the manor?

Surprise flickered in Alexander's eyes.
He thought her reputation was ruined.

But she had proven her innocence.
The netizens were now apologizing and praising her.

Her fame had only grown stronger.
This woman was nothing like the one he knew five years ago.

She was stunning.
Captivating.

Isabella didn't even look at him.
She turned to leave.

Alexander moved quickly to block her path.
"Why are you avoiding me, Isabella? You weren't like this before!"

Isabella laughed coldly.
"You weren't like this either five years ago. Need a reminder?"

She kicked a pebble at her feet.
It flew through the air.

Bam!
The pebble shattered a plant vase perfectly.

Alexander's face darkened.
"I was doing what was best for you! That child was from a rapist! Did you really want to keep it?"

"Think about it. No one knows what happened. You're not as pure as Victoria, but having a child would ruin you completely."

"Wow. Should I thank you for that?" Isabella's laugh was sharp.

"You don't need to thank me. But consider getting back with me. Nathaniel is just playing with you."

"You act like you care, but you only want my assets," she sneered. "Besides, being with a man like Nathaniel is fine. What do you have to compete with him?"

She flipped her hair and walked away.
Furious, Alexander grabbed her wrist.

"You're testing my patience, Isabella!"
###Chapter 157

Alexander’s voice carried a clear, sharp edge of menace.

Isabella remained completely unfazed. “Testing my patience? You’re the one pushing it. I’ve held back from hitting you for a full minute. Do you really want to keep talking?” She shoved his hand away and flexed her fingers, knuckles cracking softly.

“I’ll visit her soon enough,” he said darkly. “But you should think twice about being with Nathaniel. It won’t end well for you.” He turned and walked away.

Isabella let out a soft, mocking laugh. A glint of calculation flashed in her eyes as she watched him leave. She had already pushed Victoria to her breaking point. Why not push a little harder? Make her suffer even more.

As Alexander strode off, he pulled out his phone and texted Victoria, concerned.

[What’s going on? Why did they make you kneel in the prayer hall? Was it because of Isadora? Tell me everything. I need to know how to help you.]

Victoria replied instantly.

[Yes. Isabella used cleverly edited photos to frame me. She convinced everyone! Alexander, my love, you have to help me. You know me better than anyone. Other than what happened five years ago, I’ve never hurt her. I’ve been trying to rebuild our relationship. I always hoped she would come back to you so we could move forward with our plans for the shares and the diamond mine. Why would I ruin everything now?]

Alexander remembered how Victoria invited Isabella to the Guci shoot. How she offered to be her prop. He believed every word she said.

He typed back, trying to soothe her. [Don’t worry. I’ll talk to Grandfather. Then I’ll come find you.]

Victoria was kneeling on the floor in the prayer hall, reading his text. A faint, smug smile touched her lips. Under Alexander’s influence, the old man would soften. Alexander was no ordinary man. She would be out of this miserable place soon. Even with a cushion, her knees ached. Every time someone passed by, she heard their whispers.

“Shh, quiet! Victoria is in there.”

“I can’t believe how cruel and evil she is. It’s shocking.”

“Never judge by appearances.”

Her fists clenched tightly. Useless maids. How dare they mock her? Once she was free, she would teach them respect.

Unexpectedly, the door creaked open. Thinking it was Alexander coming to rescue her, she turned eagerly… Only to be met with bitter disappointment. It was Isabella.
###Chapter 158

“What are you doing here, Isabella? Do you find this amusing?”

“And what if I do? You’ve done far worse to me. Am I not allowed to enjoy the show?” Isabella’s voice dripped with icy contempt as she stared down at the kneeling Victoria.

Victoria’s jaw tightened. “You vile creature, Isabella! You planned this all along, didn’t you? Spending three days in prison just to create a scandal and destroy me at the final hour. You tricked me into signing that compensation letter. This was your scheme from the start!” she shrieked.

I’ve had them for much longer than yesterday. Do you know why I held back? Because if I’d revealed them then, you wouldn’t have put on such a convincing performance for the family today.
