Isabella pressed on, her tone soft but insistent. "Grandfather, something is wrong. I can hear it in your voice. Please, tell me what happened. Let me help you." Another long, drawn-out sigh traveled through the phone. "Ah, Isabella... So many people have called asking the same thing since yesterday. I had no other choice. Just... let it go. I don't want to burden you with this." His evasion only sharpened her concern.

Her voice firmed with resolve. "There is nothing I cannot handle. If you won't tell me, I will use every resource at my disposal to find out the truth myself." Hearing the steel in her words, Theodore finally relented. His voice dropped to a defeated whisper. "Victoria... she has Benjamin. She kidnapped him. He's her prisoner now..."

Everything clicked into place for Isabella. Of course. That explained everything. It was the only leverage powerful enough to force Theodore's hand. To make him surrender his shares and use his influence to rehabilitate Victoria's name. The woman had finally made her move against the family directly. Isabella had anticipated this escalation. "Don't worry, Grandfather. Looking at her current strategy, Benjamin is her only valuable asset. She won't risk harming him. I give you my word. I will get him back safely within three days."

"Truly? You're certain?" A fragile thread of hope wove itself into Theodore's weary tone.
###Chapter 432

Benjamin was his only grandson. Theodore Montgomery’s concern was completely justified.

“Yes,” Isabella answered calmly. “Don’t worry, Grandpa. But please don’t let Victoria know we spoke. I’ll do everything I can to save Benjamin.”

“Alright, Isabella. Be careful. Victoria… She’s changed so much it frightens me now.” Theodore had believed Victoria would free Benjamin after he transferred his shares. Instead, she extended their agreement, stating she’d only release him after her reputation improved. Meaning, Theodore remained under her control.

Isabella’s lips curved slightly. “Don’t worry, Grandpa. I’m not the same person I was five years ago. I can handle this and protect myself.”

Theodore sighed, finally relieved. Inside his prayer room, he opened a drawer and spoke to a portrait with deep emotion. “Did you hear that? Isabella has grown into a remarkably capable woman. She can take care of herself now. We don’t need to worry about her anymore…”

Ending the call, Isabella stared at the overcast sky with fierce determination. Benjamin had vanished after Victoria’s wedding. But he’d also packed his belongings beforehand, indicating he planned to leave. She’d heard Victoria hired Takashi Yamamoto to train him. Was Takashi involved? If Benjamin had gone to Westhaven, things would become complicated.

Isabella retrieved her phone and texted Maxwell.

[Isabella: Locate Benjamin’s current whereabouts. Keep this completely confidential.]

[Maxwell: Understood.]

Just then, Oliver approached with a plate of toast. “Mommy, try this toast! I made it myself!”

“Thank you, Momo.” Isabella took a piece. The breakfast machine had perfectly controlled the heat and timing, resulting in a soft, delicious slice. “Momo is so talented!” she praised warmly. “This is really yummy!”

“Yay! Momo is clever, and my sister will be cute and clever too!” Oliver beamed, gazing expectantly at Isabella’s stomach.

Isabella was speechless.

Nathaniel joined them at the table. He took some toast and a glass of milk, instructing Oliver, “I’m returning to the company today. You stay home and look after Mommy and your sister.”

“Don’t worry, Daddy. Momo will complete his mission!” Oliver saluted.

Isabella felt a pang of confusion. She could handle a childish Oliver, but a childish Nathaniel? How disappointed Oliver would be when he discovered there was no sister.

Nathaniel’s phone lit up on the table.

[Sebastian: Results from 30 DNA tests are in. Major updates! Get to the company now, Bro. You won’t believe who was in that room!]

Nathaniel frowned. The presidential suite was his private domain. No one accessed it without permission. How could Sebastian claim over 30 DNA profiles were identified from that room? This meant they might finally track down the woman from five years ago.

Finding the truth now… his relationship with Isabella… Nathaniel instinctively glanced at Isabella sharing toast with Oliver—a heartwarming scene. He quickly looked away, grabbed his suit jacket, and headed out. Regardless of who it was, he needed closure. He wouldn’t let this jeopardize what he had with Isabella.
###Chapter 433

Shortly after Nathaniel departed, Isabella received a text from Maxwell.

Maxwell: I’ve confirmed Robert was taken to Westhaven by Takashi Yamamoto. They’re staying in a secluded mountain estate with heavy security. Approaching undetected will be difficult.

Isabella’s brow furrowed. Takashi Yamamoto was not known for his charity. Why would he help Victoria? Clearly, some underhanded deal had been struck.

Another question nagged at her. Why had Victoria remained at Montgomery Manor after securing sixty percent of the family shares? Why was Benjamin still up on that mountain?

A thought occurred to her. Her fingers flew across the screen.

Isabella: Maintain surveillance. Identify their patterns and vulnerabilities. Do not engage until I give the order.

Maxwell: Understood.

Isabella pocketed her phone, the online headlines flashing through her mind. She turned to Oliver.

“Momo, are you getting bored staying indoors? Would you like to go out with Mommy?”

“Yes! Yes!” Oliver bounced with excitement.

Since Nathaniel and Oliver had moved into her residence, they had avoided public outings. The fear of McKenzie’s photographers kept them confined. The mere prospect of leaving the house thrilled him.

But then…

“Won’t the bad Auntie find us? What if she tells Grandpa and Grandma to take me away?” Oliver’s lower lip trembled.

Isabella ruffled his hair. “Don’t worry, sweetheart. No one will recognize us. Mommy will give you a makeover.”

She led him to her dressing room. Using special child-safe cosmetics, she transformed his features. His large, doe-like eyes were reshaped into a sharper, more angular shape. His full lips were made to appear thinner. Strategic contouring gave his face a less cherubic, more defined look.

She topped it off with a stylish golden wig and dressed him in a trendy, street-style outfit. The elegant little boy was gone, replaced by a cool, slightly spoiled-looking kid.

Oliver stared at his reflection, clapping his hands in delight. “Wow! I love it! I look like a little superhero! Ready to protect Mommy and my sister!”

Isabella smiled warmly. “I’m glad you like it.”

She then turned her attention to herself. With skillful application, she softened her own striking features, creating a more subdued, ordinary appearance. A simple white dress completed the look of a typical, unassuming stay-at-home mother.

She studied her reflection, a satisfied smirk playing on her lips. So, Victoria thought she could just stay, did she? She had clearly pushed her into a corner, but Victoria wasn’t finished. She must have another card to play before she’d finally leave.

Isabella had no intention of giving her the chance to play it. She would ensure Victoria had no opportunity to salvage her reputation in the days to come.

Isabella hailed a taxi with Oliver and headed downtown to Whitmore Plaza. The mall, owned by Whitmore Enterprises, was a bustling hub of restaurants and entertainment—a shopper’s paradise.

Remembering her plan, she bent down to Oliver’s level. “Momo, you need to be extra good today, okay? It will be very crowded. Do not wander off. Wait for my instructions.”

“Don’t worry, Mommy. I’ll be good,” Oliver promised, his eyes wide with excitement. His father rarely took him to crowded places, usually arranging for private shopping. This was a thrilling first for him.

Seeing his anticipation, Isabella took him straight to the fifth floor. It was the mall’s main entertainment level, packed with arcade games, children’s play areas, dart boards, and bowling alleys.

The main attraction, however, was the long rows of gleaming claw machines. They were filled with an array of adorable plush toys—Hello Kitty, Mickey Mouse, and various other cute animals.

Isabella scanned the area. The person she expected to see wasn’t there yet. Her eyes narrowed slightly. It seemed they would have to wait a little longer.
###Chapter 434

Oliver's eyes sparkled at the sight of the arcade machines.
That spark vanished just as quickly.
He noticed a figure in the distance and immediately tugged Isabella's arm.
"Let's go," he whispered urgently.

Isabella looked down at him. "What's wrong, Christopher?"

"I saw Amelia," he mumbled, his voice low. "Uncle Gregory's daughter. She'll make fun of me if she sees me here. And Daddy... Daddy always said these machines are a waste of time. He never lets me play."

Isabella's expression tightened. Uncle Gregory? She recalled Nathaniel had a younger brother, Gregory Blackwood. Gregory constantly battled Nathaniel for control of the family empire, always losing. To his credit, Gregory was a shrewd businessman. He'd married Sophia Delacroix, an acclaimed actress from an old-money dynasty. The press adored them as the perfect power couple.

Naturally, since Gregory and Nathaniel were rivals, his daughter Amelia would despire Oliver. The entire Blackwood clan, it seemed, looked down on the boy.

Isabella squeezed his small hand and smoothed his hair. "Christopher, look at you today. Your disguise is perfect. She won't recognize you. And remember, I'm right here. No one gets to bully you. Not on my watch. Now, tell me the truth: do you want to play that claw machine? Do you want to show Amelia Blackwood what you can do?"

He nodded instantly, his earlier fear replaced by determination. "Yes! I really do!"

"Then let's go." She led him firmly toward the arcade.

Inside, Amelia Blackwood was furiously jabbing at a claw machine controls. She'd already wasted a stack of tokens with nothing to show for it. She stamped her foot in frustration.

Just then, a woman and a child entered her line of sight. The woman wore a simple white dress that radiated a quiet grace. The boy... he was dressed like a tiny rockstar, but that wasn't what caught Amelia's eye. He was clutching a gigantic lollipop, bigger than his own head! He happily licked at it as he walked, a picture of pure joy. A whole necklace of other colorful lollipops hung around his neck.

Amelia's mouth watered. Despite her privileged life, her parents enforced strict, perfectionist rules. Sugary treats like this were completely forbidden. The temptation was overwhelming.

"Hey, you!" she called out, her tone imperious. "I want one of those! Give it to me!"

Oliver flinched instinctively. Her voice brought back memories of her constant taunts, her cruel words about his mother, her sheer disdain. But this time felt different. He felt the steady, reassuring warmth of Isabella's hand in his. He looked up, meeting Amelia's gaze with newfound courage.

"No," he stated clearly. "Get your own mommy to buy you one." He then took an exaggerated, satisfying bite of his giant candy, his eyes never leaving hers.

His defiance only infuriated her more. Amelia planted her hands on her hips. "Do you even know who I am? Do you know who my parents are? I'm a princess! You have so many, you have to give me one!"

"Well, I'm my mommy's prince!" Oliver shot back. "And I won't! Come on, Mommy, let's play!" He pulled Isabella toward an empty machine.

On their way to buy the candy, Oliver had confided in Isabella. He told her how Amelia had mocked him since they could barely walk, how she'd turned other children against him, and the time she'd pushed him into the garden pond.

A cold fire ignited in Isabella's eyes as she stared at the spoiled girl. So you're the one who's been tormenting my son. Your little reign of terror ends today.
###Chapter 435

Isabella turned away from the pouting girl. She led Oliver to a brightly lit claw machine.

Her fingers moved with practiced precision. The metal claw descended with perfect timing.

It grasped the coveted cat plushie Oliver had been eyeing. With a smooth motion, the prize dropped into the retrieval chute.

The oversized plush was nearly as tall as Oliver himself. He hugged the soft toy with visible delight.

"Mommy's incredible! You're the best mommy ever!" His joyful exclamation echoed through the arcade.

Amelia watched from a distance, her expression souring. She had wasted countless tokens trying to win that exact toy.

This woman achieved it on her first attempt! Pure luck, nothing more.

Isabetha smiled down at her beaming son. "What else would you like, sweetheart? Point to anything."

Oliver's eyes scanned the glass cases. "That bunny! The fluffy white one with pink ears!"

She tousled his hair affectionately. "Consider it yours."

Amelia rolled her eyes dramatically. Surely this woman couldn't replicate that fluke.

Her jaw dropped when the machine whirred to life again. Another prize tumbled out effortlessly.

Oliver applauded with unrestrained glee. "You did it again! Thank you, Mommy!"

"Wait here, darling." Isabella settled him onto a nearby velvet bench.

He obediently nodded, giant lollipop in hand. An assortment of won toys surrounded him like a colorful fortress.

Isabetha continued her winning streak. Prize after prize joined the growing collection.

Other children paused their games to watch in awe. Their envious glances focused on Oliver's mountain of plush toys.

Amelia's bottom lip began to tremble. She had nothing to show for her efforts.

Tears welled in her eyes as another toy joined the pile.

A loud, hiccupping sob escaped her. "It's not fair! You have so many!" She glared accusingly at Isabella. "Why won't you share? I want one!"

Isabella regarded her with cool detachment. "Whose child is this? Such poor manners." She turned back to Oliver. "Let's find something else to play, my love."

Oliver gathered his treasures with difficulty. His happiness radiated from his beaming face.

Amelia's wails intensified into full-blown tantrum. "Meanies! Horrible, nasty people!"

A well-dressed couple approached through the crowd. The man carried himself with understated elegance in his tailored suit.

The woman moved with theatrical grace, her floral dress swaying. This was Sophia Delacroix, scion of a renowned acting dynasty.

Trained in classical theater from childhood, she had become a celebrated prodigy. Her film performances earned critical acclaim and numerous awards.

She secured the Best Actress trophy by twenty. Marriage into the Blackwood family cemented her status among the elite.

Her reputation as devoted wife and mother remained impeccable within high society circles.
###Chapter 436

Isabella dropped to her knees and wrapped her arms around Oliver. Her voice was laced with worry. "What's wrong, sweetheart? Your father and I only stepped away for a minute. Did someone upset you?"

He burst into fresh sobs. "It was a lady and her boy! They looked shabby. They saw my nice clothes and laughed at me! They flaunted all the prizes they won right in my face!"

Oliver pointed a trembling finger. "Over there! It's them!"

Isabella followed his gaze and saw the retreating figures of Isabella Montgomery and her son. Her brow furrowed in distaste. These common people dared to bully her child?

She looked at her husband, Gregory. "Darling, you must handle this. Our son deserves justice!"

"Don't fret," Gregory assured her calmly. He appeared gentle, but his eyes held a steely resolve. "I'll contact Alexander immediately. I'll ensure he personally escorts them from the premises and adds them to the plaza's permanent ban list."

He moved aside to make the call. Isabella Montgomery walked away with her son, their arms overflowing with stuffed toys. The spectacle drew curious stares from other shoppers.

Remembering her next objective, Isabella stored all the prizes in a locker.

Just then, a stern-faced manager approached her. "Madam, you've been placed on our restricted list. You and the child must leave the premises immediately."

A blacklist? Isabella's eyes narrowed. This was unexpected. Whitmore Plaza didn't arbitrarily ban patrons. Her sharp gaze scanned the area and landed on a couple watching from a distance.

Gregory Blackwood stood holding their daughter, Amelia. His wife, Sophia, stood beside him. Both observed the scene with cold satisfaction. Amelia wore a smug, triumphant smirk that clearly said she had won.

Isabella let out a soft, derisive laugh. They thought they could have her thrown out? How amusing.

She reached into her purse and produced a matte black card. "Are you absolutely certain you want me to leave?" she asked, her voice dangerously quiet.

The manager and nearby security guards froze. Their eyes locked on the card. Their expressions shifted instantly to one of sheer panic.

It was the Obsidian Card. Fewer than ten existed worldwide. Only the most powerful elite could obtain one. Even their employer, Alexander Whitmore, didn't possess this level of access.

All staff underwent rigorous training to recognize this card. Offending its holder was a career-ending—potentially life-altering—mistake.

The manager's head bowed immediately. "Our most profound apologies, Madam. A terrible error has been made. We beg for your forgiveness."

"You make a habit of ejecting customers based on 'errors'?" Isabella's tone was icy. An aura of absolute authority radiated from her, the kind born from immense power.

Her glare swept over them. "Go inform those adults to control their ill-mannered child."

"Yes, Madam. Immediately." The manager scurried away without a second glance. Offending the Blackwoods was preferable to angering an Obsidian Card holder. Rumor claimed only Nathaniel Blackwood himself held one.

Amelia, Sophia, and Gregory, who had been waiting for the satisfying sight of the pair being humiliatingly removed, watched in confusion as the security team marched toward them instead.

Amelia stamped her foot. "You idiots! What are you doing? Throw them out!"

The manager's voice was firm, devoid of its previous deference. "Our apologies. After a full review, we found the other party violated no plaza rules. They will not be banned."

He continued, his tone formal. "Furthermore, CCTV footage confirms Miss Amelia Blackwood was the instigator of the conflict. We strongly advise Mr. and Mrs. Blackwood to provide better guidance for their daughter. Continued behavior of this nature will damage her reputation."

Three faces flushed a deep, mortified red. How dare a mere employee speak to them with such impudence? Who did he think he was?

The realization hit them. His attitude had been servile moments ago. It only changed after he spoke to that woman. She was behind this.

Who was that common-looking woman to command such fear? To make the manager choose to insult the Blackwoods rather than cross her?
###Chapter 437

The crowd closed in around Gregory, Sophia, and Amelia.

Whispers spread like wildfire through the onlookers.

Sophia immediately shielded her face with her sunglasses.

"We'll handle her discipline properly," she stated through gritted teeth.

"Why are we leaving? They're the ones who—"

Not even her mother offered comfort.

"Daddy will find out who she is," he promised in a low voice. "This isn't over."

[Track the woman and the boy. Now.]

Isabella walked away from the arcade with Oliver.

She had come to Whitmore Plaza for a specific reason.

Her target was nowhere to be found.

Had Alexander broken his old routine after all these years?

A group of serious-looking men in suits emerged from the elevator.

They moved with an air of importance, following one man.

Alexander Whitmore led the pack, listening to reports as he walked.

A faint smile touched Isabella's lips.

Some habits never die.

He still conducted his monthly inspection on the tenth.

Victoria would know this schedule too.

If Isabella remembered correctly, Victoria would be here today.

Victoria's public image had been carefully rebuilt.

But it was a facade, purchased with money and lies.

Isabella knew the truth.

She was here to shatter that illusion.

Victoria slipped into Alexander's private office.

Isabella knelt down to Oliver's eye level.

"Sweetheart, I need your help with something important."

Oliver nodded eagerly, his small face serious. "I can do it!"

She whispered her instructions quickly.

He listened intently before marching off with determination.

The game was finally turning in her favor.

It was time for Victoria to face the consequences.

Alexander returned to his office after the rounds.

He found Victoria waiting for him on the sofa.

She wore an elegant white dress, her hair tied back simply.

She looked every bit the refined socialite.

He ignored her and walked straight to his desk.

"What are you doing here?" His voice was cold.

He sat down and began reviewing documents, dismissing her presence.

She noticed his new assistant was not Harrison.

Another clear sign of his distancing.

Victoria remained calm.

She stood and quietly closed the office door.

"Get out," Alexander growled without looking up.

He was sick of her manipulations.

He never wanted to see her deceitful face again.

Victoria's composure cracked slightly.

Her eyes reddened with unshed tears.

"After ten years, Alexander? This is how you treat me?"

Her voice trembled with feigned hurt. "I've given you everything!"

He finally looked up, his gaze icy.

"Helped me?" He let out a cold, harsh laugh.

"Stop the act, Victoria. I know every single thing you did was for yourself."

He leaned forward, his words cutting deep.

"You're a nobody with a fabricated past. You clung to the Kensingtons out of desperation."

His eyes bore into her. "You tried to use me in your pathetic schemes against Isabella."

"Did you really think I wouldn't discover the truth?"
###Chapter 438

“You pretended to help me win Isabella while secretly plotting her death! You never intended for me to actually connect with her!”

“Did you really think I wouldn’t discover your little scheme with Harrison? That you tried to seduce Nathaniel Blackwood?”

Alexander’s voice was ice. Each word cut through the air like a shard of glass.

His expression held no trace of their past warmth. Only cold contempt.

Victoria flinched. Her face drained of color.

He knew. He knew everything.

A slow, bitter laugh escaped her lips. “Fine. No more lies. You’re right. But ask yourself this—who pushed me to this?”

“You think I did this for myself? Before I tried to seduce Nathaniel, you were all I wanted! But you? You fell for Isabella long ago! You stopped loving me ages ago!”

Her voice broke with raw pain and fury.

Alexander’s frown deepened. Her words echoed in his mind. ‘You fell for Isabella long ago.’

Was that true?

He adjusted his collar irritably. “If you hate me that much, then get out. I want nothing more to do with you.”

Victoria’s smile turned mocking. Hah! Nothing to do with her? How easily he said that.

He could discard her because his heart belonged to another. But he was the man she had loved from the start!

Driven to desperation, she had tried to claim Nathaniel for herself.

All she ever wanted was to marry Alexander, be his wife, build a life together. And what did she get?

She cooled her emotions, recomposing herself. “I don’t want anything to do with you either. I’m here to propose a business deal.”

“I’m busy. Not interested.” He picked up a document, dismissing her. He had no patience for a woman who betrayed him.

“After you acquire those shares, you will marry me.”

“Marry you?” He looked up, his tone dripping with condescension. “Are you insane?”

The words stabbed her heart. She was once the world's top supermodel, the woman he vowed to marry. Now he looked at her with pure disgust.

She swallowed her pain. “Don’t worry. I don’t need a grand wedding. Just the paperwork. It will salvage my reputation.”

The negative articles were suppressed, but only thanks to Theodore Montgomery’s money. Buying热搜, scrubbing the internet, paying for fake comments—it cost a fortune.

But it was all surface. Everyone still mocked her. The Montgomerys despised her.

“It will be a marriage on paper only,” she added. “I won’t interfere in your life. Furthermore, I’ll sell you my sixty percent stake at half its market value.”

Alexander’s eyes darkened. The offer was significant.

Following her plan, he could buy a controlling sixty percent at a massive discount. Combined with the other shares, he would own seventy-five percent of the entire company.

He would effectively control the Montgomery Group.
###Chapter 439

Victoria watched as Alexander slowly began to believe her scheme was possible. A subtle smile touched her lips.

“Alexander, it’s just paperwork—no ceremony, no announcements. We can draft a separate agreement stating the instant Isabella agrees to marry you, we divorce immediately. Until she accepts you, we play our parts. I get my reputation restored. You get the Montgomery shares. It’s a win for you.”

She spoke with confidence, but cunning simmered behind her calm expression. Once married to Alexander, her reputation would be salvaged. She would become the dazzling Mrs. Whitmore!

Moreover, once Alexander acquired Sophia and Penelope’s fifteen percent, the rest of the Montgomery family would hold no power. They would be left with nothing! So what if Isabella revealed her true identity then? So what if Isabella returned to the family?

By then, the Montgomery name would be a hollow shell. The family that scorned her would have nothing! When they finally uncovered the truth about her, the Montgomerys would be ruined and penniless!

If Victoria couldn’t be the heiress, neither would Isabella! Alexander sensed hidden motives in Victoria’s plan…but he didn’t care. The offer was too tempting.

Victoria wanted her reputation and to destroy Isabella. He wanted control of Montgomery Group. With those shares, his wealth would double!

Still…

He locked eyes with her. “Why should I trust you? You despise me. Why give me this chance?”

Even to save herself, she could have found another buyer. Sixty percent of shares at half price was a discount of billions! Many would marry her for that! Many! If no one would, she could sell the shares, leave Westchester, and start over abroad!

Victoria held his gaze. “Even if you don’t love me, you’re still the man I love. Besides, if I sold to someone else, Isabella might just buy them back. What’s the point in that?”

She wanted the entire Montgomery family to collapse. She wanted it beyond saving, even with Isabella’s money!

The Montgomerys looked down on her? Soon, they would understand true despair!

Instead of running, she would become Mrs. Whitmore. She would watch Isabella return to a ruined family…a family under Alexander’s control! Alexander studied her. After a moment’s pause, he said, “I agre—”

Before he could finish…BANG!

The door burst open. A cool-looking boy with blond hair stood in the doorway. “Brother, don’t believe her! She’s lying! I heard her on the phone in the stairwell! She said she has no cash and needs to use someone! She said once the share price rises, her stocks will be worth more! She talked about the Montgomerys buying back her shares, Isabella wanting them—even you would want them! Then she could sell high and watch you all fight! She plans to use the shares to force you to stay married! She wants to get pregnant with your child to trap you with sympathy!”

What?

Alexander’s face darkened. His gaze turned icy as he glared at Victoria. How calculating could she be?!

Victoria shook her head frantically. “Alexander, don’t listen to him! I’m not like that! Why would I do that? Someone must have sent him to ruin our deal! You can’t trust a child!” She jumped up and moved toward the boy.
###Chapter 440

Victoria Kensington snarled at the cleverly disguised Oliver Blackwood. “Who gave you permission to enter? You—”

“Ahh! I didn’t make any of this up! Don’t hurt me! Please! Big brother, save me!” Oliver cried out, scrambling to hide behind Alexander Whitmore.

Alexander’s gaze shifted from Victoria’s furious expression to the trembling child behind him. “Get out, Victoria Kensington,” he hissed.

He never wished to lay eyes on that deceitful woman again.

Victoria’s eyes reddened as a cold dread washed over her. “Alexander, you would trust the words of some random child over mine?”

Before Alexander could respond, Oliver quickly piped up, peeking out from behind him. “You sounded so wicked on that phone call! Who would ever believe you? Doesn’t your tongue ache from all the lies? Can you swear to God everything you said was true? If anything you said was a lie, may you die?”

Victoria’s face lost all color. Her offer regarding the shares was genuine; she truly intended to sell them to Alexander at half their market value. As for the marriage, she had hoped to gradually win his sympathy… “I never imagined you could be this malicious, Victoria,” Alexander noted her hesitation, his expression darkening. “Security! Remove her at once!”

Immediately, the security team entered and began dragging Victoria out of Alexander’s office.

She screamed, “Alexander…! Alexander! Please, you have to believe me! I never planned to inflate the share price or force you into anything! I just wanted you to eventually develop feelings for me…!”

Why would Alexander believe her now?

He waited until the guards had hauled her away before slamming the door shut with a loud bang. He never wanted to see her face again.

The security team dumped Victoria in a deserted corridor. She collapsed onto the cold floor—seething with anger, consumed by fury, and wracked with pain. It was over. Completely over! She had hoped to use Alexander’s name and influence to salvage her ruined reputation. If he had forgiven her and publicly acknowledged their marital status, she could have reclaimed her social standing. She longed to witness the Montgomery family’s bankruptcy, see Isabella fail to repurchase the shares, and watch the entire Montgomery dynasty crumble to dust. But now, that was nothing but a distant, shattered dream. It was truly over for Victoria! Alexander’s trust was irrevocably broken. No matter who she sold her shares to now, Isabella would find a way to buy them back!

Was her only option now to flee with the money and helplessly watch Isabella rescue the Montgomery family?

Victoria remained on the floor for a long time. After confirming there was no path back to Alexander, she had no choice but to leave the plaza.

Once inside her car, her new assistant, Penelope, was there, offering her a cup of coffee. “Madam, please, rest for a moment.”

The moment Victoria took the coffee, the scalding heat burned her hand. “Couldn’t you let it cool down first?” she snapped at Penelope. “How am I supposed to drink this?”

“I’m sorry! I’m so terribly sorry!” Nearly crying from fear, Penelope bowed her head and apologized profusely. The sight of her only infuriated Victoria more. Ever since her loyal agent, Isadora, had been imprisoned, nothing seemed to go right for her. Argh! She felt she would lose her mind if she stayed in Westchester a moment longer!

Unable to bear the pressure any longer, Victoria pulled out her phone and sent a text to a contact named Rex: [Contact potential buyers. Sell my shares off in separate lots. No need to rush. Aim to drive the price up, but ensure absolute discretion. No one must know.]

Victoria was desperate to cut ties with the Montgomery family quickly, but their shares weren’t worth a fortune. Waiting a few more days could net her a few extra million. Besides, leaving the Montgomerys too soon would be a gift to Isabella. She had to leave a parting gift for Isabella before she made her exit!

Isabella Montgomery stood composed and aloof within Whitmore Plaza. A cold, arrogant smirk touched her lips as she watched Victoria’s car speed away from the building. Did Victoria really think she could play games with her? She should take a long, hard look in the mirror first! Still, Isabella was curious to see what other tricks Victoria had hidden up her sleeve.
###Chapter 441

Back in Alexander’s office…
Alexander studied Oliver after Victoria left them.
“You did me a favor. What would you like in return?”

“Nothing, thank you! I don’t need anything. I enjoy helping others. But if you insist on rewarding me…”
Oliver pointed at the ring on Alexander’s thumb.
“You could give me that jade ring.”

It was a white jade ring with intricate carvings.
Emerald green patterns swirled through the pale stone like a dragon soaring through clouds.
Alexander smiled faintly at the boy’s boldness.
“You want nothing else but this ring? Do you know its value?”

Of course Oliver knew.
He had seen it at an auction with Nathaniel last year.
An antique piece that sold for ninety million.
He had loved it instantly, but his father refused, calling jade too feminine for a man.
Now was his chance.

Oliver kept his expression innocent.
“I don’t know the price, but it’s beautiful. Just like you!
I didn’t want to interfere—I was afraid that woman might retaliate.
But when I passed by, I saw how handsome you looked!
You even match well with… Isabella Montgomery.
That’s why I stepped in to help.
You and this ring share the same elegance.
I’d like to keep it as a keepsake.”

Oliver’s tone was soft and charming, nothing like his usual voice.
Lately, Alexander had been in a foul mood, but the boy’s words eased his tension.
“You think Isabella and I look good together?” he mused.

“Absolutely! They say children have a good eye for these things.
I’ve seen the news about you two.
You make an exceptional pair.
If you stay sincere and persistent, I believe she’ll return to you!”
Oliver declared with earnest conviction.

It was the first time anyone had spoken to Alexander with such encouraging honesty.
Without the boy’s intervention, he would have fallen into Victoria’s trap.
Buying 15% of the Montgomery shares without securing the promised 60% would have been useless.
Wasting twenty billion would have strained his cash flow and created unnecessary risk.

Moreover, this child had risked his own safety to help.
Victoria was not one to forgive easily.
Alexander’s gaze sharpened as he handed the ring to Oliver.
“Take it. If anyone gives you trouble, show them this ring and mention my name.”

The name ‘Alexander’ was engraved inside the band.
Few in Westchester would dare cross him.

Oliver accepted the ring joyfully.
“Thank you, Big Brother! You’re so generous!”
He beamed. “I’ll never forget you!”

With that, he clutched the ring and dashed out.
The moment he left the office, he nearly gagged.
If it weren’t for the ninety-million-dollar ring, he would never have said those nauseating things!
He knew Alexander had hurt his mother before.
This was payback.
He wondered how Alexander would react when he realized he’d been tricked by a child.
Haha!

Isabella waited upstairs for Oliver.
She saw him approaching with a wide, mischievous grin.
“What took so long, Momo? Did he harm you?”
“No, no. He thanked me and gave me this jade ring as a reward.”
Oliver handed the ring to Isabella.

She examined the antique piece.
Its craftsmanship and material spoke of immense value.
Why would a man like Alexander part with something so precious?
“Momo,” she pressed, “what exactly did you do?”
“Nothing much! I just told him what he wanted to hear.
He gave it to me willingly.
We can sell it later and invest in a ninety-million-dollar amusement park!”
Oliver chirped happily.

Seeing his delight, Isabella asked no further questions.
They left the mall together, content and satisfied.
###Chapter 442

Nathaniel Blackwood sat in his office at the top floor of Blackwood Corporation.
He held a document listing thirty-seven names.
Thirty-six were female staff from The Grand Monarch hotel.

The investigation results were clear.
All thirty-six women had fantasies about touching Nathaniel.
They were obsessed with him, his suite, even his bed.
They had rolled on the sheets where he slept.
That explained why their DNA was found there.
Thirty-six different women had slept in Nathaniel's bed over the years.

Sebastian tried to comfort him.
"Don't worry. I've already ordered their termination."
He flipped to the final page nervously.
"Look at this last person."

Nathaniel's eyes narrowed.
The name on the last page was Sophia Whitmore.
That name hadn't crossed his mind in over a decade.

When Nathaniel was eighteen, he attended Westchester University.
He was the wealthiest heir in the city.
She was a scholarship student from a poor family.
Sophia was delicate, fragile like a flower.
Yet she persevered, working multiple part-time jobs.
It was the first time Nathaniel encountered someone so determined despite poverty.
Out of sympathy, he helped her a few times.
She became one of the few women he allowed close.

His family assumed they were in a relationship.
They paid her five million to leave the country.
Sophia was forced to abandon her education and dreams.
Nathaniel always felt guilty about what happened.
He tried to find her for years to make amends.
But she had vanished completely.
Over time, he pushed the memory aside.
He never formed any special connections with other women.

Until five years ago.

Sebastian watched his brother's reaction anxiously.
"Bro, what do you think? Sophia must have returned to Westchester."
"We just haven't located her yet."
"If Christopher is really her son..."

Nathaniel's expression darkened.
He had considered many possibilities.
But never that Sophia would reappear after ten years.
If she was the woman from that night five years ago...

Sebastian paced the room nervously.
"Damn it... Even you're speechless!"
"What if it's confirmed? What then?"
"I've invested so much effort helping you win Isabella."
"If your relationship falls apart because of this, I'll suffer the consequences."

Whenever Nathaniel was unhappy, Oliver became upset.
Then Oliver would complain to Uncle Sebastian.
When Nathaniel was happy, Sebastian felt like a third wheel.
When Nathaniel was upset, Sebastian bore the brunt.
Life was so unfair.

Nathaniel's gaze sharpened on Sophia's name.
"It's not a big deal."

Sebastian stared blankly. "Huh?"

Nathaniel closed the folder decisively.
"Find Sophia. Verify if it's really her."
"I'll handle the rest."

His feelings for Sophia were only pity and sympathy back then.
With a faint admiration for her resilience.
When he learned she was forced away, guilt consumed him.
But he had fought hard to win Isabella's heart.
Why would he abandon Isabella for Sophia now?

Of course...
If Isabella discovered his history with Sophia, would she be angry?
Would she despise him for it?
###Chapter 443

A dark thought took root in Nathaniel's mind. He turned to Sebastian with grim determination. "Keep this entire matter from Isabella. She must not know."

He couldn't risk anything before making her his wife.

Sebastian frowned deeply. "Brother... You're planning to conceal this from Isabella?"

"It's not concealment. I'll address it when the time is right." He would handle everything appropriately.

Nathaniel gave Sebastian's shoulder a firm pat before walking out. Sebastian felt uneasy but hoped his brother could manage the situation before Isabella discovered the truth.

Neither man noticed the figure hiding in the bathroom.

Vivienne.

She had come to Nathaniel's office that morning hoping to negotiate. Those photos of him with Isabella were her bargaining chips to force their separation.

The sudden arrival of both brothers forced her into hiding. But her eavesdropping rewarded her with explosive information.

Nathaniel was still searching for the woman from five years ago.

And that woman was likely Sophia Whitmore.

Jealousy burned through Vivienne at the thought of that penniless girl. Born into poverty, Sophia had been all doe-eyed vulnerability and pathetic weakness. Exactly the type to ensnare men's souls.

Vivienne despised her.

She had grown up with Nathaniel since childhood. Shared sandboxes and childhood dreams. Yet he never once looked at her with interest.

Worse, he had grown inexplicably close to Sophia when he turned eighteen.

She had conspired with Beatrice Blackwood to send Sophia away years ago. Never expecting her return.

Was she truly at The Grand Monarch five years ago?

If the woman he slept with was Sophia... then she would be Oliver's mother...

Vivienne's fists clenched tightly. Sophia took the five million and left Westchester. Yet she bore Nathaniel's child?

The more she thought, the more Oliver's watery eyes resembled Sophia's!

Rage simmered within her.

But her assistant Cassandra quickly intervened. "Madam, please remain calm. This is actually beneficial. Consider what Isabella would do upon discovering Sophia's existence?"

Vivienne gradually cooled at Cassandra's reasoning. She had a point.

Knowing Isabella's temperament, she would undoubtedly target Sophia. Even if she didn't, she would never tolerate Nathaniel keeping another woman in his heart.

Once Isabella was out of the picture... Sophia posed no threat. She was a fragile flower that could be crushed with minimal effort.

"Find Sophia," Vivienne commanded coldly. "Get to her before Sebastian does."

"Yes, Madam."

Meanwhile...

Nathaniel drove back to Rosewood Manor, memories from a decade ago flooding his mind.

Back then, Sophia was constantly bullied by wealthy university boys. No matter how they tried to buy her, she never yielded. She fought back fiercely.

Despite her powerlessness and poverty, she stood firm without wavering. He had never encountered such determination and strength in a woman.

He had pitied her then.

Those feelings faded over the past decade. He never thought of her until Sebastian's revelation today.

Would Isabella misunderstand if she learned about this?

When he arrived at Rosewood Manor, he found Isabella and Oliver playing checkers in matching cute pajamas. The late afternoon sun cast a warm glow over them.

The sight was breathtakingly beautiful and heartwarming.

All his doubts instantly vanished as his gaze fixed on Isabella.
###Chapter 444

Isabella’s face was bare and fresh from the shower, yet her beauty remained breathtakingly hypnotic.

Some women possessed a fleeting allure that faded with familiarity. Isabella’s was timeless.

Her radiance never dulled. Day after day, it held the same magnetic intensity.

Her eyes, especially… They glimmered like crystals drawn from ancient wells—clear, luminous, yet touched with a knowing depth. They were story-filled, compelling.

Her beauty stood in stark contrast to Sophia’s. Sophia inspired protectiveness. Isabella commanded distance.

Just then, Oliver noticed him and beamed. “Daddy! You’re home! Come say hi to the baby!”

Nathaniel frowned. Say hi to the baby?

Isabella was equally confused. “The baby in Mommy’s tummy!” Oliver chirped adorably. “I read that talking to the baby makes it smarter after birth.”

“Watch!” He turned toward Isabella’s abdomen and waved. “Hi, little sister! I’m your big brother! I’m playing checkers with Mommy now. When you come out, I’ll play with you every day! Look—Daddy’s back.”

Isabella and Nathaniel exchanged uneasy glances. Lying to a child like Oliver was a terrible mistake.

Oliver met everything with eager anticipation. His imagination knew no bounds. How would he react when he learned the truth?

Forget the future. How would he accept that his Mommy wasn’t actually pregnant?

Isabella had never faced a situation this delicate.

Nathaniel hesitated. He paused to hang his suit jacket. Then he moved toward them.

“She’s still very small,” he said gently. “She won’t start growing for another month. You should read more science books, or your friends might tease you.”

“A whole month?” Oliver looked puzzled.

Isabella ruffled his hair affectionately. “Daddy’s right. The baby hasn’t begun developing yet. We usually start interacting after three months. It’s common knowledge.”

Three months… Isabella wondered where she and Nathaniel would stand by then. Maybe by then, she’d find a better way to explain.

Oliver pouted, disappointed by their answer. “Oh… okay.”

Seeing his downcast expression, Nathaniel quickly changed the subject. “Look what I brought.”

He handed Oliver a paper bag. Inside were his favorite Orleans-style roasted chicken wings.

Oliver’s eyes lit up instantly. “Wow! Thanks, Daddy! I love you!”

Clutching the chicken wings, his mood lifted immediately. He scampered to the dining table to eat.

Isabella watched his lively little figure and smiled. Children were so pure. Their joys came so easily.

She turned to Nathaniel. “How was work? Tough?”

His expression darkened. Work wasn’t the problem. What weighed on him was far more complicated.

He had helped Sophia out of pity. But he’d helped her many times over the years.

If Sophia truly was the woman from that night, and Oliver was really her son… would Isabella still trust him?
###Chapter 445

Isabella noticed the sudden intensity in Nathaniel’s gaze when she asked her question. It was as if he were wrestling with something dark and complicated. She rarely saw him look so conflicted. “What’s wrong? Is it that difficult to talk about?”

“No.” He snapped back to the present, his eyes locking onto hers with fierce protectiveness. “Isabella, I need you to promise me something.”

“Hmm?” She tilted her head, curious.

Nathaniel’s voice was low and serious. “There might be… complications ahead. Things that could test us. I need you to trust me completely. No matter what you see or hear—trust that I will handle it. Don’t let anyone plant doubt in your mind.”

His expression was so grave it made her chest tighten. Was this about the incident five years ago? Had he uncovered something disturbing? Something that might hurt her?

A soft smile touched her lips. “You don’t have to worry. When I choose someone, I don’t waver. If I did, it wouldn’t be love.”

His eyes darkened at her words. Love. Did she really love him? He hoped so. He needed to clean up the past—fast.

After he left to deal with some documents, Isabella watched him go, her mind racing. She quickly sent a message to Maxwell. [Ask the Uncles if they’ve found anything new about Nathaniel’s incident five years ago.]

Maxwell replied almost instantly. [Will do. But there’s something more urgent.] [Tiffany is secretly trying to sell her shares. They could be gone within two days. She also just showed up at the office. Looks like she’s pushing a big project.] [We scouted Uji Quin’s compound. The place is covered in infrared sensors. The terrain is a nightmare. Even my best men can’t guarantee we can extract Robert safely.]

Isabella’s expression tightened. So Tiffany was getting desperate.

If Maxwell’s team couldn’t handle it, the mission was borderline impossible. That meant she had to go herself.

It wasn’t that she was more skilled than they were. But her body was smaller, more flexible. At the training base, she’d always been the one who could slip past detectors without setting them off. It was her specialty.

After a moment’s thought, she typed back. [Keep monitoring Tiffany. Proceed with the plan. How is Robert? Is he hurt?]

[Not physically. But it’s complicated. Robert doesn’t realize he’s been kidnapped. Uji Quin has him convinced that fasting unlocks gaming potential. The idiot hasn’t eaten or drunk anything since he got there.]

Isabella almost laughed. Robert was so sharp in some ways, so painfully naive in others. If she didn’t act soon, he might actually starve.

She glanced toward the dining room where Oliver was. Then she replied. [Prepare the jet. I leave for Kansas at midnight.]

The flight from Westchester to Kansas would take two hours. If she moved quickly, she could be back before dawn.

Tiffany didn’t return home after leaving Whitmore Plaza. She went straight to Jordan Group and demanded an emergency board meeting.
###Chapter 446

Victoria Kensington stood before the boardroom, presenting the nationwide Garden Properties initiative. She announced the requirement for a hundred-billion-dollar loan to fund the ambitious venture.

The room erupted in immediate dissent. "Ms. Kensington, have you lost your mind? A hundred billion is impossible!"

"Are you ignoring our current crisis? Montgomery shares have plummeted, causing a hundred and fifty billion in losses already. Now you want to borrow another hundred billion?"

"This project will bankrupt Montgomery Group if it fails!"

Even Penelope Sinclair voiced her concern. "Victoria, this is far too dangerous. We must be cautious."

Victoria remained seated in the director's chair, her expression unwavering. "Setting aside the financial aspect, is this not an exceptional project?"

The board members exchanged uneasy glances. Silence fell across the room. They couldn't deny the project's potential brilliance.

Their nation was advancing sixth-generation garden properties, granting even modest homes the luxury of beautiful gardens. Major developers were testing similar projects in limited regions. If Montgomery Group launched this nationwide, they would dominate the industry within two years.

But the risk was astronomical. One hundred billion dollars. Even utilizing all available Montgomery funds would leave them fifty billion in debt. Failure meant utter destruction.

"I recognize your apprehensions," Victoria addressed the tense atmosphere. "However, remember that I now hold the Director position. Any consequences will fall upon me. I accept full responsibility for this venture."

"If I'm willing to risk everything, why shouldn't you support me? Trust my judgment. I want what's best for this company. This risk promises the most substantial returns."

"I will personally secure the loan. It won't take long."

The board gradually yielded to Victoria's determined conviction. She spoke truth—she controlled the majority shares and would bear the ultimate burden. Her fearlessness became their reassurance.

Success meant enormous dividends. Crucially, with Montgomery Group hemorrhaging money, securing bank loans would signal financial confidence to investors. The new project could reshape their perception entirely.

The proposal passed with full board endorsement.

Victoria proceeded directly to the bank negotiations, carrying the Montgomery Group's official seal. Alone in her car, pure malice glittered in her eyes. Her scheme was falling into place perfectly.

She would leave Isabella Montgomery a devastating farewell gift.

The Montgomery family learned the news that same evening. Victoria was conspicuously absent from dinner.

Eleanor Kensington pressed her father. "You still haven't explained why you transferred all your shares to Victoria. Is she truly capable of handling such responsibility?"

"I find her too young and impulsive. If that fifty-billion loan gets approved, Montgomery Group faces tremendous danger for the next two years," worried Penelope added.

Gregory Kensington sighed heavily. "I would oppose it, but I have no voice anymore. Not a single share remains with me."

"Don't worry. The bank likely won't approve such an enormous loan," Richard Montgomery attempted to reassure them.

Theodore Montgomery listened silently, deep in thought. Why would Victoria take such a colossal gamble? This decision would either save or destroy the company!

She had already kidnapped Benjamin. What wouldn't she do?

Victoria sought to prove her capability. She wanted to restore her reputation. As the Montgomery heiress, the group's bankruptcy served no benefit to her.

Just as Theodore prepared to speak, the dining room door swung open.

Click!

All eyes turned toward the entrance. Victoria stood framed in the doorway.
###Chapter 447

Victoria had returned to the mansion earlier but lingered outside the dining room upon hearing their heated discussion. She knew they all despised her, yet hearing their words still turned her stomach.

The Montgomerys were never her true family. They even doubted her ability to lead the Montgomery Group. The thought of her carefully laid plans and her imminent departure from this wretched family brought a dark satisfaction. These people would soon face utter ruin and destitution! Ha! That was the price for crossing her! Her next move was to ensure every detail fell perfectly into place. She smoothed her features into a mask of placid determination and stepped into the room with a faint, practiced smile. “Grandfather, Father, Mother, Aunt Penelope, Uncle Gregory. The loan negotiation is successful. The funds will be transferred within two days.”

“Is that true?” Eleanor’s eyes widened in disbelief. Victoria secured a 50-billion loan? What bank would agree to such a massive amount? Of course, Victoria would never reveal she had mortgaged every single asset of the Montgomery Group, including the corporate headquarters. She replied with feigned calm, “Mhm. I presented our entire project proposal and offered them the highest possible interest rate. They’re willing to take the calculated risk on the Montgomery Group. I understand the concerns regarding this venture, but please trust my resolve and my capabilities. No one wants this project to succeed more than I do. I aim to prove my worth and compensate the company for any past… setbacks. In two years, our profits will soar, and our market valuation will increase by at least fifty percent.” Her ambitious declaration made Penelope and Gregory look at her with newfound interest. A fifty percent increase? Their shares would be worth a fortune! Penelope beamed with sudden approval. “Oh, Victoria, please disregard my earlier comments—I was merely anxious. If the bank has approved the loan, we have faith in your project’s success. We can simply tighten our belts for these next two years.” “Do not worry. You are my closest family. I would never hold it against you.” Victoria smiled sweetly, maintaining her impeccable facade. Though most still harbored resentment, her performance offered a sliver of reassurance. Eleanor, now calmer, recalled her earlier harshness and felt a pang of guilt. If she had wanted to meet Alexander instead of Harrison, it wasn't Victoria's fault, yet she had scorned her. Eleanor sighed inwardly; Victoria was such a diligent and forgiving daughter… She fetched a clean set of cutlery for her. “Sit, Victoria. You look thinner. You should rest at home these next few days and focus on your health.” “Thank you, Mother. Keeping busy is the only thing that makes me feel better. Actually, there is one more matter. I… Never mind. Let’s eat.” Victoria pretended to hesitate, then picked up her spoon. As anticipated, this only piqued their curiosity further.

Eleanor pressed, “What is it? You can tell us. We will help you.” “I… well, actually…” Victoria feigned reluctance, drawing out the pause. “I know my past actions were… disappointing. But many circumstances were beyond my control. Things would not have escalated so badly if someone hadn’t deliberately worked to sabotage my public image. I wasn’t sure if this person was targeting me specifically or the entire Montgomery family, so I launched a private investigation. We managed to interrogate an assistant, and she… She claimed…” Victoria trailed off, her expression growing troubled, as if she couldn’t bear to continue.

Penelope, ever the meddler, urged her on. “Victoria, who was it? Just tell us! We’ll deal with them!” “Yes. To be fair, this person is clearly malicious, constantly leaking those damaging clips. Just say the name,” Eleanor encouraged, her tone supportive. Victoria bit her lip, appearing genuinely conflicted and anxious before slowly uttering the name, her voice laced with feigned uncertainty…
###Chapter 448

“The assistant swore…it was Isabella…”

Isabella Montgomery? The atmosphere instantly chilled. Theodore Montgomery’s eyes narrowed, his displeasure directed at Victoria. “Victoria, you know how I despise liars. I will not tolerate baseless accusations within this family!”

“I understand your skepticism, Grandfather. I, too, was reluctant to believe it initially. But her assistant was adamant. If we analyze the pattern, the first photo leak coincided with the Chanel show, where Isabella ultimately replaced me. The second incident occurred during her wedding to Alexander Whitmore. She never intended to marry him; her heart belongs to another. The third leak happened at my wedding. She clearly opposed my union with Alexander.”

Victoria nodded. “Yes, I’ve witnessed it myself. Alexander Whitmore and Seraphina Delacroix are also aware. His identity remains a mystery to us. You are welcome to verify this independently.” She dared not mention Nathaniel Blackwood; the consequences of involving him would be catastrophic.

Isabella’s refusal to return to the family estate… Was that indicative of another relationship?

Adam Montgomery interjected, a thought striking him. “If she had no desire to marry Alexander, why sabotage your wedding? She was the one who encouraged it…”

They had monitored Isabella closely. She had always comported herself with maturity regarding the past, showing no lingering attachment to Alexander. While her demeanor toward Victoria was cold, orchestrating such a public ruin seemed out of character.

What? She was there?

Eleanor frowned. Hadn’t Victoria been late to the ceremony that day?

Their fight escalated. I moved to intervene, to protect Isabella, but Alexander accidentally pushed her. She has always believed I pushed her intentionally. You can call her and ask if you doubt me.” Victoria was confident. If Theodore called Isabella, his question would be direct: ‘Did Victoria push you down the stairs?’ Isabella’s likely response, ‘Grandfather, you knew?’ would confirm her narrative.

Since returning from Africa, her sole focus has been revenge…” She looked pleadingly at Eleanor and Richard Montgomery. “Mother, Father, recall her first day back? Before she left, she whispered in my ear that she would utterly destroy me. That she would take everything from me until we were ‘even.’

“I’ve tried to explain, to reason with her, but she refuses to listen. She systematically strips me of everything I hold dear, meticulously planning my downfall. I never imagined my own sister could be so cruel…” Victoria’s voice broke into a weak sob, tears tracing paths down her cheeks.

The family was stunned. According to Victoria, Alexander accidentally caused the fall five years ago, and Isabella had been ruthlessly exacting vengeance ever since? All the negative press targeting Victoria was part of Isabella’s elaborate scheme? Merely over an accident Victoria claimed Alexander caused?

Richard Montgomery slammed his hand on the table with a roar. “This is monstrous! She is your sister! How could she do this? I’m calling her this instant! She will return here and answer for this!” He pulled out his phone.
###Chapter 449

Victoria did nothing to stop Richard as she wept softly into her hands.

Her sobs were perfectly timed, delicate and heart-wrenching.

She had secretly installed a blocking application on both Richard and Eleanor's phones.

The program automatically rejected all calls from Isabella Montgomery.

Just as she predicted, Richard heard the automated message.

"The number you have dialed is not in service."

She blocked him!

Victoria cried harder, her voice trembling with manufactured pain. "Dad, Mom, please stop calling her... She told me she resents you both for loving me more. She'll never come back. I'm not saying this to gain sympathy—I just want you to accept me. Everything I did... I was forced into it. I wouldn't be like this if Isabella hadn't destroyed me first. Her delicate features contorted in genuine-looking agony.

"I thought if I tried harder, she would eventually accept me!" Victoria's voice broke. "I believed that even if she hated me, she wouldn't sabotage our family's reputation... But I was wrong... I never imagined..."

Gregory shook his head with a dramatic sigh. "What a waste, what a shame. If it weren't for Isabella, Victoria would still be the top supermodel. She used to give us lavish gifts every month! Now we have nothing! It's disgraceful!"

The room erupted in agreement, each voice layering on another complaint.
