Theodore remained silent, his face stern, brows deeply furrowed.

He didn't fully believe Victoria's story.

But she had encouraged them to call Isabella, seemingly without fear.

And she was desperately trying to win back their favor.

It didn't seem like she was lying.

Had Isabella truly done all this?

Had she sought revenge without any regard for the family's honor?

It appeared he would have to speak with her directly.

"Let's eat," Theodore finally said, rising slowly. "I will handle this."

He leaned heavily on his walker as he left the dining room.

Victoria watched him go, a spark of triumph in her eyes.

She might be leaving soon, but she would make sure Isabella's return was hell.

She would ensure Isabella was despised by everyone.

Once Theodore returned to his study, he took out his phone and dialed Isabella's number.

The same automated message greeted him.

"The number you have dialed is not in service."

His expression darkened.

Was she really with another man?

Was that why she refused to come home?

Who was he? Nathaniel Blackwood?

Theodore recalled how Nathaniel had publicly supported Isabella.

But would the prestigious Blackwood family ever accept someone like her?

Impossible!

His lawyer approached quietly. "Mr. Montgomery, do you still wish to transfer all your assets to Isabella?"

Theodore had made that decision days ago.

Victoria had taken his shares.

Benjamin was useless.

He feared all his property would eventually fall into Victoria's hands.

He worried Isabella would be bullied and left with nothing.

He wanted her to have something to rely on.

Something that would ensure her security and independence.
###Chapter 450

Theodore Montgomery never expected such complications. Transferring his assets to Isabella would spark family-wide opposition. He dismissed the idea with a weary wave. "Not now."

At Rosewood Manor.

Isabella plugged in her silenced phone while preparing for her Westhaven flight. She cradled Oliver, reading until his eyelids grew heavy. By eleven, the child slept peacefully in his bed. "I have to go out," she whispered to Nathaniel. "Watch Christopher for me."

He glanced up from his documents. "At this hour?"

She gave a firm nod. "Benjamin's in serious trouble. This requires my personal intervention."

"I could arrange—"

"Your men can't handle this situation," she interrupted. "It demands specific expertise. Stay with our son."

Isabella retrieved her tactical gear from the dressing room. Nathaniel didn't argue when she resolved like this. Yet after her departure, he immediately contacted Dominic. "Deploy a hundred men to shadow her."

"Yes, sir!"

Driving her compact car from the estate, Isabella noticed multiple missed calls from Theodore. She tried calling back but received no answer. Unusual behavior for her grandfather—he never called repeatedly without urgency.

Suspicion gnawed at her. She executed a sharp U-turn toward Montgomery Manor while contacting Maxwell. "Delay the flight one hour. I'm checking on my grandfather first."

The manor's gates stood locked at eleven, all lights extinguished. Only the entrance lamp cast a feeble glow across the property. Isabella rang the bell repeatedly until a guard appeared.

"Miss Montgomery? You've returned?"

"I need to see my grandfather." She moved to enter but found her path blocked.

"Apologies, but the Senior retired quite distressed tonight. I must inform Sir and Madam before granting entry."

Isabella's eyes narrowed. Since when did she require permission to enter her own home?

Even during her most unpopular years, no one had barred her from the family estate. This was unprecedented.

"What happened today?" Her voice turned icy and sharp.

"Unclear, Miss. Evening orders stated you couldn't pass this gate without authorization. Please understand I'm following instructions."

The adjacent guard was already calling Richard. The phone soon transferred to Isabella. She accepted it with a frosty expression, curious what explanation her uncle would offer.
###Chapter 451

Isabella took the phone, her expression hardening instantly. “What do you want?”

“What do I want?” Richard’s voice was a low, furious growl. “How dare you use that tone with me? Have you finally decided to grace us with your presence after all your gallivanting? Do you think Montgomery Manor is some cheap motel you can check into whenever it suits you?”

His anger escalated with every word. “Letting your mother bring you home was the biggest mistake of my life!” he spat. “You destroyed your own reputation five years ago, and now you’re trying to drag your sister down with you? You’ve shamed the Montgomery name! I should have ended you the day you arrived. It would have saved us all this disgrace!”

Isabella was blindsided by the tirade. Before she could form a response, Eleanor snatched the phone.

“Whatever Victoria did to you, even if she pushed you down those stairs, she is still your sister!” Eleanor’s voice was sharp, laced with venom. “That bastard child never should have existed! How can you be so vindictive? Holding a grudge for five years and now trying to ruin our family’s standing? You are utterly ungrateful!”

Isabella’s face went cold. So they knew. Victoria had gotten to them first, spinning her web of lies.

“You need to take a long, hard look at yourself, Isabella,” Eleanor continued, her words like shards of glass. “Stop spreading your legs for every stranger you meet. You’re an embarrassment. If you ever want to set foot in this house again, you will apologize to your sister. Properly. Then, and only then, might you be allowed to move your things back in. But if you think you can treat this estate like your personal flophouse, you can forget it. I wish we’d never taken you in. To me, you’re already dead!”

Each syllable was a deliberate blow. Apologize to Victoria? Sleeping around? They were swallowing every lie Victoria fed them, even after her own scandals. How could they be so blind? Did tears and dramatics always win over the truth?

Eleanor didn’t give her a chance to defend herself. She barked orders to the security team. “Make her leave. If any one of you lets her past the gates, you’re all fired. Every last one of you!” The line went dead.

The guards looked at Isabella with palpable anxiety. “Ms. Montgomery, please… don’t make this difficult for us.”

Isabella stared at the imposing Montgomery Manor. The grand, picturesque facade now felt like a cruel joke. This was her birthright, stolen from her for twenty-three years by Victoria.

Now, even returning was a battle.

A dark, cold smirk touched her lips. Soon. Very soon, they would all be on their knees, begging for her return.

She tossed the phone back to the guard and turned on her heel.

Saving Benjamin was the priority. As for Grandfather…

She slid into her car and quickly typed a message to Theodore Montgomery. [I don’t know what lies Victoria has told you, but trust nothing from her mouth. I will explain everything when I return.]

She powered off her phone and sped toward the private airfield. None of them had any idea. The adopted daughter they despised was their true heir.

At the private airport…

As Isabella’s car screeched to a halt, Maxwell was already waiting, flanked by ten of his most elite agents. They stood at rigid attention, bowing in unison as she stepped out. “Ms. Montgomery!”

Their respect was absolute. Their orders had come from the very top: protect this woman at all costs. Maxwell had told them only she could get to Takashi Yamamoto’s mountain stronghold. Where they would fail, she would succeed. Her capability was beyond question.

Isabella’s brow furrowed slightly at the sight of the large contingent. Too many.
###Chapter 452

“Why bring such a large team? Send them back to rest.”

“You’re heading to Westhaven. We have no operations there. Extra manpower ensures safety,” Maxwell explained.

Isabella countered sharply. “I’m going directly to Takashi Yamamoto’s mountain. I’ll retrieve Benjamin and return immediately. They can’t even ascend the summit… unless they intend to become mosquito bait at the base?”

Maxwell fell silent at her logic.

“Return to base and rest,” Isabella ordered the ten men.

They hesitated, disappointed. Accompanying Isabella on missions was a rare honor, yet she dismissed them so effortlessly.

Her point stood: What purpose did they serve besides being insect food at the mountain’s foot?

The team reluctantly agreed.

Isabella boarded the plane with Maxwell. The jet headed straight for Westhaven. A sudden thought struck her. “Is Takashi Yamamoto home tonight?”

“No, he’s a night owl. Clubs every evening. Poor Mr. Kensington remains trapped in the basement, starving himself foolishly.” Maxwell sighed.

Isabella relaxed. Takashi’s absence simplified everything. She entered the dressing room, changing into her stealth mission suit. She checked all necessary equipment.

Ninety minutes later, the plane landed silently on a secluded Westhaven mountain peak. The spy-model aircraft attracted zero attention.

“Landing on Takashi’s mountain would alert his guards. Driving there takes approximately one hour.”

“Understood.” Isabella exited the plane, entering a waiting vehicle. They sped toward the mountain.

The driver suddenly warned, “Maxwell, Boss Montgomery, we have a tail.”

Isabella glanced back, her sharp eyes instantly recognizing Dominic Sterling behind the wheel.

Had Nathaniel sent Dominic to monitor her?

“Ignore them. They’re with me,” Isabella stated calmly.

The driver relaxed while Maxwell frowned. With her? Was Boss Montgomery no longer cautious around Nathaniel?

What about Mr. Kensington?

The car reached the mountain base. Isabella stepped out, adjusting her custom sunglasses. She moved toward the slope.

“Exercise extreme caution, Boss Montgomery,” Maxwell called out anxiously. “If anything seems off, retreat immediately. Don’t take unnecessary risks.”

“I know what I’m doing.” Isabella calibrated her glasses. These specialized lenses detected infrared beams invisible to the naked eye.

Scanning the mountain, she observed a dense network of infrared tripwires. Triggering any would set off alarms.

Heh. Did they really think this could stop her?

She advanced steadily, her black tactical suit emphasizing her lethal grace in the darkness. Isabella moved with cold, calculated precision.

Approaching the first infrared beam, she simply arched her back smoothly, clearing it effortlessly.

The driver watched from the car window. “Hey Maxwell, want to bet? I wager Boss Montgomery reaches the summit within an hour.”

“One hour?” Maxwell frowned. Even sprinting without obstacles took over an hour from base to peak. How could Isabella possibly achieve that?
###Chapter 453

The driver grinned widely. “If Boss Montgomery reaches the summit within an hour, I get ten days of paid vacation!”

“You’re on,” Maxwell replied.

Even though he was fully aware of Isabella’s capabilities, the mountain was treacherous. Scaling it in under sixty minutes while dodging every single infrared sensor seemed nearly impossible.

But up on the ridge, Isabella didn’t follow the main trail.

She moved with purpose, scanning her surroundings with sharp eyes.

She headed straight for the area with the highest concentration of infrared beams.

Places with heavy security usually hid the most valuable secrets.

Just as she anticipated, after maneuvering through an intricate web of lasers, a narrow passage came into view.

It was carved directly into the cliff face, resembling an ancient mountain pathway.

Only one person could pass through at a time.

The entire corridor was lined with overlapping infrared grids.

Isabella’s brow furrowed.

What was Takashi Yamamoto hiding? Was he really just a professional gamer?

This level of security felt excessive.

She took a deep breath and began her approach.

She dropped into a low crouch, then sprang forward with explosive speed.

Her movements were a fluid dance—leaping, twisting, scaling the rock wall, sometimes crawling flat against the ground.

Every muscle in her body was perfectly toned.

Under the pale moonlight, her silhouette moved with an almost supernatural grace.

It was like watching a panther stalk its prey.

Roughly forty minutes later, she stood at the mountain’s peak.

Down below, the driver had been dozing against the steering wheel.

A soft chime from the monitor woke him.

His eyes snapped open.

The screen displayed a system notification: [Target has reached destination.]

The altitude sensor confirmed she was at the summit.

The driver turned to Maxwell with a triumphant smirk. “I win!”

Maxwell had been waiting in tense silence outside the vehicle.

His eyes widened in disbelief.

Forty minutes.

Boss Montgomery conquered the peak in forty minutes.

He realized, once again, that he had underestimated her limits.

At the top stood a sprawling European-style mansion.

From a distance, Isabella could make out numerous guards patrolling the grounds.

She quickly assessed her surroundings.

The nearest guard was about three meters away—the most immediate threat.

She pulled out a custom-designed air pistol.

With a nearly silent release, it fired a small pellet.

Isabella immediately covered her mouth and nose.

The pellet was one of her uncles’ inventions.

It released a colorless, odorless gas that could knock out anyone within a ten-meter radius.

Within moments, every guard in the vicinity collapsed.

Even the sentries at the main entrance slumped to the ground unconscious.

Isabella sprinted toward the mansion.

She slipped through an open window with practiced ease.

Her intel indicated that Benjamin was being held in the basement.

She activated her infrared scanner and swept the interior.

Areas with unusual energy concentrations stood out immediately.

It didn’t take long to locate the basement entrance.

But she wasn’t in a rush.

She took a moment to scan the rest of the mansion.

Then she moved swiftly toward the control room.

Within seconds, she hacked into the security mainframe and disabled the entire defense grid.

Every infrared beam throughout the compound vanished instantly.

The system attempted to send an intrusion alert to Takashi Yamamoto.

Isabella terminated the signal before it could be transmitted.
###Chapter 454

It was finished.

No more barriers stood in her way.

Isabella sprinted toward the basement entrance.

The space had no windows.

A single dim yellow bulb glowed on the wall.

Benjamin lay on a Japanese-style tatami mat, sleeping deeply.

She approached and nudged his leg with her foot.

"Wake up. You're coming with me."

His eyes fluttered open.

Recognizing her, his brow furrowed in confusion.

"Why are you here?"

"You'd starve if I didn't come," she retorted. "Get up. Now."

He remained on the floor.

"I'm not leaving. I'm training with Takashi Yamamoto."

Since arriving at the mansion, Takashi had preached about inner peace.

Gaming required total isolation from external distractions.

A secure, dark environment was essential.

Benjamin had been skeptical initially.

But Takashi descended to the basement to demonstrate.

He claimed this very space helped him find his 'gaming rhythm' years ago.

So Benjamin stayed.

Days and nights blurred together.

He avoided food and drink, seeking that elusive inner tranquility.

Perhaps it was psychological, but his skills had sharpened noticeably.

Why abandon such progress?

Isabella tapped his forehead.

"Think he's actually teaching you? This was all Tiffany's scheme. She conspired with Takashi to abduct you."

"She used a photo of you here to extort Grandfather's thirty percent shares."

"Her entire offer to train you was a trap. Your disappearance shattered our parents. They surrendered their shares to her."

Benjamin froze, processing the accusation.

Then he shook his head vehemently.

"Impossible. I don't believe you. Victoria would never do that."

"See for yourself when we get home. Move. Now. If Takashi returns, we're trapped."

She grabbed his arm to pull him up.

He yanked his arm free.

"I said no! What awaits me at home? More backstabbing? More plots over shares?"

"Even Victoria, the one person who cared, has become a stranger. There's nothing left for me there."

"Here, I can focus. I can improve. I'll return one day and prove gamers can succeed too."

A cold laugh echoed from the staircase.

"You think you can teach him? Arrogant."

Isabella spun around.

Takashi Yamamoto descended the stairs.

He wore burgundy silk pajamas, his chest bare.

He exuded the aura of a decadent playboy.

One hundred bodyguards crowded the entrance behind him, blocking escape.

He wasn't supposed to be here. He should still be at the nightclub.

His return was alarmingly swift.

Takashi toyed with two jade beads in his palm.

"Disappointed? Didn't expect me? I admit, breaching my security impressed me."

"A gut feeling brought me back early. Good thing I listened."

Isabella met his gaze icily.

"Kidnapping is a crime. You and Tiffany are partners in this?"

"I have no idea what you mean," he replied smoothly.

He turned to Benjamin.

"Benjamin. Come stand by me. Tell her: Did I kidnap you?"

"Yes, Master." Benjamin nodded obediently and moved toward Takashi.
###Chapter 455

Isabella’s eyes narrowed sharply. She seized Benjamin’s wrist, yanking him firmly behind her. “Stay behind me,” she commanded, her voice low and dangerous. “Don’t move an inch. I won’t hesitate to break your hand. You’d never play another game in your life.” Her threat was delivered with a chilling intensity. Though Benjamin was prideful and resistant, the aura she projected was utterly terrifying. He froze, too scared to argue, and obeyed without another word.

Isabella knew the situation was escalating. They needed to leave, and fast. “You actually believe you can learn from Takashi Yamamoto?” she scoffed, her tone dripping with disdain. “His skills are mediocre at best. Studying under him will only ruin your potential.” The insult hit its mark perfectly.

Takashi Yamamoto’s face flushed with anger. “How dare you question my ability just because you bypassed my security, Isabella! You’re a clueless woman. Know your place and shut your mouth!” He could tolerate many things, but having his gaming prowess insulted was unforgivable.

Seeing she had successfully provoked him, Isabella locked eyes with him. “If you’re so confident, then prove it. Right here, right now. A one-on-one match. If I win, I take Benjamin and we walk out of here. If I lose… I’m yours to command.” Her challenge hung in the air.

Takashi threw his head back and laughed. “Hahaha! A one-on-one? With me? Did you all hear that?” He turned to his bodyguards, who erupted in mocking laughter. They looked at Isabella as if she were a complete fool.

“A woman challenging Mr. Yamamoto?”
“Do you have any idea who you’re dealing with? He’s been the undefeated champion of Eternal Champions for twenty consecutive seasons!”
“Shouldn’t you be home cooking or sewing? Gaming? That’s a joke!”

Humiliation burned through Benjamin. “Isabella, just leave! You’re embarrassing yourself! And you’re ruining everything for me! Get out of here!” He feared his chance with his idol was crumbling because of her.

Isabella ignored him completely, her cold gaze never leaving Takashi. “Stop wasting time. I’ll ask one more time. Do you dare to accept?”

“Such arrogance! Of course I accept! Let’s do it!” Takashi rolled up his sleeves and strode toward two high-end gaming setups in the basement. He powered them on, smirking arrogantly. “Right here, right now. You win, you both go free. I win… you stay here and serve me.”

“Deal. I expect you to be a man of your word,” Isabella stated calmly, taking a seat at one of the computers.

Takashi sat at the other. They both clicked the game icon simultaneously. Everyone watched Isabella, their expressions a mix of pity and ridicule. A woman challenging Takashi Yamamoto? This was a foregone conclusion. She would be annihilated in seconds.

Benjamin couldn’t bear to watch. “Isabella, stop this humiliation! You’re no match for Master Yamamoto! Please, just go!” he pleaded, desperate.

“Step back and be quiet,” Isabella shot back dismissively. She logged into her account.

Benjamin was about to protest again when his eyes caught the system notification flashing on her screen: (Welcome back, Boss!)

Boss?
The name sent a jolt through him. It sounded incredibly familiar. His mind raced. Then it hit him. ‘Boss’ was the legendary, anonymous player who had defeated Takashi Yamamoto in a historic match. The only person ever to do so.

Could Isabella possibly be… Boss?
No. That was impossible. It couldn’t be her.
###Chapter 456

This had to be a coincidence! Isabella Montgomery simply shared the same username as that legendary player. Boss—nothing more than that! Then, Isabella sent a duel challenge to Takashi Yamamoto. A game notification flashed across Takashi’s screen. [Boss has invited you to a 1v1 duel!] A smaller line of text followed below: [Friendly Reminder: Player Boss has previously defeated you—stay alert.]

Takashi’s expression darkened. His eyelids twitched. Boss—the very player who had humiliated him before—was challenging him again. But wait… He was supposed to be facing Isabella. Why would Boss send him an invitation now?

Unless…

A shocking realization dawned on him. He spun around, his eyes locking onto Isabella’s monitor. Her screen displayed: [Duel request sent. Waiting for opponent to accept…]

Takashi froze. His disbelief was palpable. It was her. Isabella was the one who had crushed him, costing him billions. The Boss he had desperately tried to hunt down. The only person in the world capable of defeating him. The legendary player who had nearly forced him to rename himself “Dog”!

Benjamin Kensington, standing behind Takashi, was equally stunned. His eyes widened in shock. How… how was this possible? His own sister was Boss? The mythical figure every gamer revered?

Even the bodyguards at the entrance were speechless. They knew their master had suffered only one defeat—a humiliation that had followed him everywhere. Rivals and enemies never let him forget it. They had all underestimated Isabella, dismissing her as just another woman who knew nothing about gaming. Never in their wildest dreams had they imagined she was the legendary Boss who had humiliated Takashi Yamamoto.

Isabella remained calm, her gaze cool and impatient. “What’s wrong? Scared now that you know it’s me?”

Takashi snapped back to reality, his face flushing with anger. “Who said that? I made a few mistakes last time. Do you really think you can beat me again?”

He clicked the accept button, and the duel began. Instantly, thirty percent of Takashi’s followers received a notification: [Takashi Yamamoto is now in a 1v1 duel with Boss…]

The online community erupted. Players flooded into the spectator mode. Even those offline dropped everything to log in and watch. The comments section exploded. [Takashi didn’t change his name after losing to Boss last time. Why are they fighting again?]

[He claimed it was a fluke, that Boss cheated. Let’s see if it was really a coincidence!]

[I still think it was luck. Watch Takashi destroy Boss in seconds!]

Takashi read the comments, his resolve hardening. He had to win this time, no matter what. His reputation depended on it. He remained hyper-focused, waiting for Isabella to select her character. Just like before, she chose the Dancer.

Takashi’s eyes narrowed. The Dancer again? That same character had defeated him last time. But… Hah! He quickly locked in Daji, the Witch—a character known for her instant-kill abilities. The Dancer’s skills were primarily defensive, making her useless against the Witch’s aggressive playstyle. Two of the Dancer’s skills would be completely ineffective in this matchup.

Hah! Isabella didn’t stand a chance this time. Takashi smirked, already envisioning her defeat. He would reclaim his glory and make her beg for mercy on her knees.
###Chapter 457

Isabella Montgomery kept her eyes fixed on the computer screen, completely ignoring Takashi Yamamoto.

The match began. Since it was a player-versus-player format, both characters started with all their skills unlocked. No leveling up was required.

Takashi immediately launched an attack with his Witch character. The Witch possessed three key abilities. Her first skill was a debuff that reduced the opponent's defense by thirty percent. This made targets vulnerable and easy to hit. Her second skill cast a spell that stunned the opponent for one and a half seconds. Her ultimate ability unleashed a torrent of violent flames, capable of eliminating any foe in mere seconds.

These three skills spelled certain doom for the Dancer.

Takashi was determined to finally defeat Isabella.

Benjamin Kensington stood behind his sister, utterly speechless. He stared at the two screens without blinking. He still couldn't believe his own sister was the legendary Boss. Overwhelmed by this revelation, he needed to see if her previous victory over Takashi had just been a fluke.

Meanwhile, hundreds of thousands of gamers worldwide were spectating the live duel. The viewer count skyrocketed past six figures.

Isabella didn't move her character. She let her Dancer avatar remain perfectly still under the protection of her crystal tower.

This inactivity provoked instant ridicule from the watching crowd. [Hahaha! Is Boss too scared to fight now?] [Hiding like a coward under her tower? Pathetic!] [Looks like Boss is going to lose for sure this time!]

Takashi felt a surge of arrogant confidence. The character he selected had a natural advantage over hers. He was absolutely certain she stood no chance of winning.

His Witch avatar swiftly closed the distance to her crystal tower. They were now only a few meters apart.

Finally, Isabella moved. Her fingers flew across the keyboard. Her Dancer emerged from the safety of the tower's shield, making herself completely vulnerable.

Takashi’s eyes narrowed. He instantly launched his first attack. But Isabella had already anticipated it. Her avatar sidestepped with lightning speed, effortlessly avoiding the blow.

Takashi scoffed. Trying to dodge? He prepared to use his second skill, the stun spell. He would finish her off in seconds!

Isabella’s special talent was useless here. Once caught in the Witch’s magical trap, she wouldn't be able to move at all. It would be an instant kill.

To his shock, Isabella activated her own special talent first: Fainting Spell. This ability rendered her opponent immobile for 1.5 seconds. The Witch was frozen in place. Takashi’s fingers were a mere tenth of a second too slow. Just one-tenth of a second!

A dangerous smirk played on Isabella’s lips. It was time for her final move. She unleashed a volley of three arrows simultaneously. The Witch’s health bar instantly plummeted to fifty percent.

Isabella triggered another powerful blow. The health bar dropped sharply to thirty percent. Takashi panicked. His eyelid twitched violently. He never expected her to activate her special talent before he could.

The Witch’s major weakness was a lack of agility compared to the Dancer. Her only defensive skill was a Sprint. But how could he use it with only thirty percent health remaining?

Damn it! He wanted revenge!

The moment the Fainting Spell wore off, Takashi desperately triggered his second ability, trying to cast the stun spell. But Isabella was ready. She activated her own second skill and sprinted away with incredible speed. It was as if she had predicted his every move. The Dancer elegantly evaded every single spell the Witch hurled her way.

Takashi’s face darkened with fury. She was running away! How was she so impossibly fast?!
###Chapter 458

Takashi Yamamoto refused to accept defeat. His eyes burned with pure rage as he pursued Isabella's Dancer. He had to activate his third ability. He needed to unleash the inferno to incinerate Isabella!

But…

He had forgotten Isabella's initial strategy. She hadn't been in a hurry to engage. She only emerged from her tower when he was practically on top of her.

Consequently, Isabella's avatar was a mere two meters from her crystal tower's safety. While his desperate final assault did land, inflicting serious damage, Isabella simply retreated back into her tower.

Even though his ultimate move had been powerful, Isabella's crystal tower continuously regenerated her health. By the time the Witch had exhausted all three of her skills, Isabella's health bar was still over half full.

Simultaneously, the Dancer's skills reset completely.

A cold smile touched Isabella's lips. She activated two skills simultaneously. She dashed toward the Witch with her second skill and unleashed a volley of three arrows with her third!

Takashi's screen went black instantly. When it brightened again, all he saw was his defeated Witch lying at the Dancer's feet.

Takashi had lost. Again.

The entire duel lasted less than sixty seconds. It was brutally fast.

The spectators were utterly speechless. A moment of stunned silence hung in the air before the crowd erupted.

[No way! OMG! That's insane!]
[Takashi lost again! The number one ranked player was defeated in under a minute! Unbelievable!]
[So precise! So ruthless! The Boss showed no mercy!]
[Her reaction time was inhuman! She attacked before he could even process it! A fraction of a second faster!]

[I'm convinced she's a seasoned pro gamer! That level of skill is unique!]
[Hah! Now Takashi can't blame it on luck this time!]
[I strongly recommend he changes his ID to 'The Loser'!]

Reading the flood of mocking comments, Takashi's face darkened with fury. He never imagined he would lose to Isabella a second time. And so humiliatingly fast.

He had never experienced such public shame in his entire life.

Benjamin stood frozen beside him, his mind reeling. The idol he had worshipped for a decade was just crushed. The teacher he held in such high regard was utterly worthless compared to… his own sister! The sister he had always underestimated was revealed to be this incredibly powerful and skilled. He looked at Isabella with entirely new eyes, filled with awe and admiration.

Isabella rose from the computer terminal. She cast a calm, dismissive glance at Takashi. “You need more practice. Goodbye.”

She turned, taking Benjamin's hand to leave. Takashi seethed with venomous hatred. Did she think she could just walk away after humiliating him like that? A person like her didn't deserve to live; she was a threat that needed to be eliminated. Immediately, he signaled his guards with a sharp look. They understood instantly.

They drew their taser batons, blocking the exit, the weapons pointed directly at Isabella and Benjamin. Isabella's brow furrowed. “Breaking your promise so easily?”

“So what?” Takashi sneered coldly, his eyes filled with malice. “The end justifies the means. You humiliated me. You're the only one who can defeat me. Do you honestly believe I'd let you leave my estate alive? How naive!”

With that, he pulled out a sharp, gleaming dagger.
###Chapter 459

Takashi Yamamoto’s eyes narrowed as he demanded sharply, “Benjamin, what do you think you’re doing? Explain yourself.”

“What does it look like I’m doing?” Takashi unsheathed his dagger. The blade glinted dangerously under the dim basement lights. A cruel smirk twisted his lips. “You have two options, Isabella. One, my men beat you until there’s nothing left. Two, you cut off your own hands and crawl out of here.”

No one was allowed to surpass him. Anyone who could defeat him deserved to be erased.

He threw the sharp dagger. It landed at her feet with a cold, metallic clang.

“Silence! Do not call me ‘Master’! Do you honestly believe I wanted you as my student? I made a deal with Victoria!” Takashi scoffed, his expression full of contempt and impatience. His gaze was icy. “With your mediocre talent? I only agreed because Victoria promised to share my bed!”

I’ve been keeping you locked in my basement all this time, and you still call me ‘Master’? Pathetic! You are a fool of the highest order!”

Takashi reveled in the destruction. He loved shattering people’s realities.

Benjamin stumbled backward, his face pale. His world was crumbling. Had it all been a lie? Had Victoria truly manipulated him so completely? Had she really traded her body to a man like Takashi just to ruin him? Was her kindness merely a facade to steal his inheritance?

That meant Isabella had been telling the truth. She had come here to rescue him.

The sister he adored had betrayed him. The sister he despised had risked everything to save him.

Benjamin’s eyes burned. His hands clenched into white-knuckled fists.

Takashi found his anger amusing. A mocking half-smile played on his lips. “What’s this? Anger? You want to go home and seek revenge? Then convince Isabella to chop off her hands. You can even do it for her! As long as her hands remain here, I will let you both leave. Otherwise…” His voice dropped to a deadly whisper. “You will both die here today.”

The words hit their mark. Benjamin froze. What right did he have? Takashi was right.

His whole life had been about games. He rejected every business and science course his family enrolled him in. He never studied. He never learned.

Victoria had secretly funded his gaming. She encouraged his addiction. He used to think it was kindness. He believed she was the only one who understood him.

Now he saw the truth. It was all a setup for his downfall. She was engineering his ruin.

Suddenly, he remembered the words Isabella had once said to him.
###Chapter 460

Use your brain and think properly for once. Think! If Victoria was truly good to you, why did she never encourage you to study harder? Why did our parents and the entire family give up on you? Benjamin, you’re thanking the very person who betrayed you!

You’re thanking the person who sold you out!

He hadn’t believed it then. He had despised Isabella for saying those words to him. Now, he regretted every second of his stubbornness. Under Victoria’s manipulation and influence, Benjamin had become nothing. A worthless piece of trash. How could he have ever protected Isabella?

Isabella, standing protectively in front of him, could feel the storm of emotions raging within him. She hoped he would learn from this. Of course, their primary concern was escaping this basement.

Just then, the impatient Takashi Yamamoto sneered. “You’re just useless trash, Benjamin. And you, Isabella, what can you do even if you’re skilled? Do you really think you can fight me and my hundred bodyguards? If you know what’s good for you, you’ll chop off your own hands and beg for your lives. Both of you will die the moment my patience runs out!”

“Oh, really? I suppose I should consider it then,” Isabella said coolly, bending down to pick up the discarded dagger. She tested its weight and sharpness, her movements deliberate.

Benjamin’s face paled in horror. “Isabella, no! Don’t listen to him!”

“Shut up! Let your sister think! One more word and I’ll kill you first!” Takashi snapped.

Even Isabella pushed Benjamin aside dismissively. “What do you know? Let the adults handle this. Takashi is right. If we cooperate, we get to live.”

“Hah! Finally, someone with some sense—” Takashi’s boast was cut short.

Isabella moved like a shadow. In a blink, she was behind him. The cold edge of the dagger pressed against his throat.

Takashi froze, completely caught off guard. He stood rigid, fear locking his limbs. Everyone in the basement stared, stunned. How was she so fast? How did she take their leader hostage so effortlessly?

The head bodyguard reacted first, lunging for Benjamin. But Benjamin was quicker, dodging and scrambling behind Isabella’s protective stance.

Isabella pressed the blade harder. A thin red line appeared on Takashi’s neck. “Everyone, step back. Now. Or this blade goes deeper,” she commanded, her voice icy and devoid of mercy.

The guards halted, rooted in place. They could only watch their captive boss, unsure what to do.

Takashi growled, furious and scared. “You’ll pay for this, Isabella! Hurting me is a death sentence! Murder is illegal! You don’t want to—”

He yelped as the dagger bit deeper. A trickle of blood ran down his neck.

“Try me,” she threatened, her gaze terrifyingly cold.

His legs trembled. “Get back! All of you, move!” he shrieked, his bravado gone.

The bodyguards reluctantly stepped back, creating a path.

Holding Takashi tightly, Isabella began moving toward the exit. Benjamin stayed close behind her. The air was thick with tension, a dangerous standoff with every step they took.
###Chapter 461

Robert trembled as he followed Isabella closely. He had never felt such bone-chilling fear before.

They were fortunate to have Takashi Yamamoto with them. They made it out of the basement and onto the outdoor walkway. The path was dangerously narrow, and accidents could happen at any moment. Isabella knew Takashi Yamamoto wouldn't let them escape so easily. He definitely had backup plans.

Her priority was ensuring Robert's safe exit from Takashi Yamamoto's stronghold. She pressed a hidden button. It was an emergency signal for Maxwell.

Beep!

Maxwell responded immediately. With the infrared deactivated and the walkway visible, he should arrive quickly.

"Go first," Isabella commanded Robert. "Just keep moving forward. Someone will be waiting for you at the bottom."

"I can't..." Robert instinctively protested. How could he abandon Isabella in such danger?

Isabella shot him an icy glare. "What good are you staying? You'll just be a liability. Go!"

Robert froze. She was right. He was useless here. He couldn't even protect himself.

Self-loathing washed over him. He hated his own weakness. Swallowing his pride, he turned toward the passage. He had to leave without causing more trouble for Isabella.

As Robert stepped onto the walkway, a bodyguard moved to intercept him. Isabella instantly dragged Takashi Yamamoto to block the entrance. She pressed her dagger against his throat.

"If even one hair on his head is harmed," she threatened coldly, "Takashi Yamamoto dies right here."

The terrified man screamed at his guards, "Don't move! Listen to her! Back off now!"

The bodyguards reluctantly retreated. No one dared touch Robert. His footsteps grew fainter until they disappeared into the night.

Takashi Yamamoto's eyes narrowed. He hadn't seen anyone at the mountain's base earlier. His alarm system hadn't been triggered either. Yet someone was waiting for Robert down there!

How many people had Isabella brought? He didn't know she only came with two men. More would have been detected. A small team was easier to conceal.

Isabella maintained her vigilant watch. Her eyes never left the bodyguards or Takashi Yamamoto's movements. Nothing could go wrong now.

Time passed slowly. Takashi Yamamoto's back ached from the tense position. He spoke with forced condescension, "Isabella, this is all a misunderstanding. Your brother is safe now. Why not let me go? I promise you'll leave unharmed."

"Shut up," Isabella snapped coldly. She was still calculating how long Robert needed to reach safety.

Takashi Yamamoto flinched at her tone. No one had ever spoken to him like that since childhood. Yet with Isabella, he didn't dare fight back. He could only roll his eyes in frustration.

How dare she treat him this way? She would pay for this!

After twenty minutes, Isabella finally narrowed her eyes. "You're right about one thing," she told Takashi Yamamoto. "Do exactly as I say, and I might let you live. Try anything funny, and you're dead."

She released her hold on his neck and delivered a powerful kick to his backside.

Thud!

Takashi Yamamoto went flying toward his hundred bodyguards. Isabella immediately sprinted down the walkway.

Pain shot through Takashi Yamamoto's buttocks as he roared, "After her! Now!"
###Chapter 462

“Yes, Sir!” Takashi Yamamoto’s hundred bodyguards immediately charged toward the wooden pathway.

Concealed in the darkness beyond the estate were his archers, poised to unleash a deadly volley of arrows at Isabella Montgomery as she fled through the forest.

Swish, swish, swish!

Dozens of arrows sliced through the night air, their razor-sharp tips aimed directly at her shadowy figure.

Isabella’s brow furrowed. Had Takashi stationed snipers around his property?

Hah!

She retrieved a compact, owl-claw grappling device and launched it skyward.

The metal claw embedded itself into a thick tree branch, allowing her to swing through the air gracefully.

In one fluid motion, she propelled herself more than ten meters forward, creating significant distance from her pursuers.

A quick press of a button retracted the device seamlessly back into her hand.

A faint smile touched her lips. Her uncles’ latest invention proved incredibly useful. The upgraded sensitivity far surpassed previous models.

She repeated the maneuver several times until she reached the mountain’s base.

The bodyguards now trailed over two hundred meters behind!

A sleek black car idled silently within the shadowy woods.

Inside, Benjamin Kensington kept vigilant watch over the path.

The moment he spotted Isabella, he flung the door open urgently. “Isabella, hurry! Get in!”

She leaped into the vehicle without hesitation.

Leaning out the window, she extended a triumphant thumbs-up before abruptly flipping it downward.

The pursuing bodyguards witnessed the taunting gesture as the car sped away.

Fury burned within them. Her skills were unnervingly superior, and she mocked them openly! Damn her!

The team leader immediately contacted Takashi. “Sir, she escaped in a black sedan.”

Upon hearing the news, Takashi’s face darkened with rage.

He hurled his phone against the ground violently. Damn it! How did that woman slip through his fingers?

She had humiliated him profoundly!

As long as she lived, he would never reclaim his title as the top player in Eternal Champions. He would remain a permanent laughingstock!

His butler approached cautiously, offering consolation. “Sir, please remain calm. Have you forgotten our earlier contingency? Her taking Benjamin away actually works in our favor. If he had died here, the complications would have been significant…”

Takashi’s eyes gleamed with sudden realization. Right, he had almost forgotten.

It was better that Isabella took him. Benjamin would still be utterly ruined regardless!

Meanwhile…

They boarded swiftly, and the cabin door sealed shut as the plane prepared for immediate departure.

Only when everyone was securely seated did a collective sigh of relief echo through the cabin.

“Boss Montgomery, you’ve shattered records again!” Maxwell Carter exclaimed admiringly. “The entire rescue took under three hours! And you successfully retrieved Benjamin!”

Isabella frowned. Three hours?

She quickly checked her phone. It was nearly six in the morning!

Oliver Blackwood typically woke between seven and eight. If he didn’t find her there, he would panic…

“Instruct the pilot to accelerate,” she ordered Maxwell urgently. “I’m on a tight schedule.”

“Understood.” Maxwell hurried toward the cockpit to relay the message.

Benjamin sat beside her, studying her intently, his emotions swirling chaotically within his gaze.

Who exactly was Isabella Montgomery? She commanded a private jet and a team of fiercely loyal operatives.

Most astonishingly, her combat skills were impeccably refined! She extracted him from a heavily guarded compound completely unharmed!

Remembering all the pain he had inflicted upon her since childhood, overwhelming guilt consumed him.

Agh! The agony was blinding!
###Chapter 463

Benjamin Kensington writhed in agony, curling into a tight ball on the leather seat. His hands clamped over his abdomen as a guttural moan tore from his throat. “Argh!”

Thud.

He wasn’t breathing.

Panic surged, but she forced it down. “The emergency kit! Now!” she barked, her voice cutting through the cabin’s hum.

Maxwell Carter was already moving. He retrieved the advanced medical kit, stocked with experimental drugs and cutting-edge resuscitation equipment.

Isabella’s fingers flew through the contents. She seized a single, unmarked white pill. Reborn. A prototype developed by her mentor, Silas Granger, and his top research team. It was designed for catastrophic organ failure, a last-chance gamble that had to be administered within thirty seconds of clinical death.

She pried his jaw open and placed the pill on his tongue. It would dissolve instantly.

Next, she grabbed the portable CPR device, pressing the electrode pad firmly to his chest. The machine whirred to life, delivering rhythmic, precise compressions.

“Divert to the nearest hospital in Westhaven!” Maxwell ordered the pilot.

“No!” Isabella’s command was absolute. “Continue to Westchester! Full speed!”

Westhaven was Takashi Yamamoto’s domain. Any hospital there would be compromised. Benjamin would be a sitting duck.

Maxwell nodded grimly, understanding the unspoken danger. He clipped small electronic nodes to Benjamin’s palms and the soles of his feet. They emitted a low-frequency current, designed to prevent neuromuscular lock-up and stimulate neural activity.

Sweat beaded on both their foreheads. The only sound was the mechanical thump of the CPR device and the low hum of the nodes.

Isabella’s mind raced. He couldn’t die. Not like this. Victoria Kensington had manipulated him his entire life. He had only just begun to see the truth. He deserved a chance to live it.

And Theodore Montgomery… How could she ever tell that gentle old man he had lost his grandson?

Her will became a tangible force. She poured every ounce of her focus into the fight for his life.

Nearly an hour later, a miracle. Benjamin’s index finger twitched.

Isabella’s breath hitched. She checked for a pulse. Faint, but there. Steadying.

“Fight, Benjamin. Do you hear me? Your grandfather is waiting. Everyone is waiting. Victoria needs to be exposed. You can’t leave this unfinished. You will not drag me down with your failure. Stay. Alive.”

He remained unconscious, unresponsive, trapped in a fragile state between life and death.

It was a critical situation.

The jet finally touched down at the Westchester private terminal. Maxwell’s team was already waiting on the tarmac with a stretcher. They carefully transferred Benjamin’s still form.

Isabella never left his side. She slid into the back of the waiting SUV beside the stretcher.

“Grace Memorial Hospital. Now,” she instructed the driver. It was the largest, most secure private hospital in the city, located mercifully close to the airport. Their exorbitant fees guaranteed immediate, discreet, and top-tier medical attention. It was his best chance.

The man sighed heavily.
Victoria, I came to take you home.
Just come with me. You’ll understand.

Home? she laughed bitterly.
Where were you when I needed you?
When my mother struggled alone?

Her voice trembled with rage.
Memories flooded back, painful and sharp.
Her eyes reddened with unshed tears.

My mother worked as a cleaner, she spat.
Pregnant and exhausted every day.
She barely slept or ate.

She had nothing when I was born.
Couldn’t even pay the hospital bills.
She died three days after giving birth.

She swapped me into the Montgomery family.
So I wouldn’t end up like her.
So I could have a better life.

I lived in constant fear.
Terrified they’d discover the truth.
I avoided hospitals, blood tests, everything.

I was paranoid about leaving evidence.
Even a single strand of hair.
Every day was a nightmare.

The man looked down, guilt-ridden.
He tried to speak her name.
Victoria cut him off violently.

Don’t say my name, she snarled.
You gave me nothing. Not even my name.
You weren’t there for twenty-three years.

Now you show up because I’m rich?
Have you no shame? No guilt?
Get out of my sight forever.

I don’t want your money, he insisted.
Victoria shoved him hard.
Go! Now! Leave me alone!
###Chapter 471

Victoria pushed the middle-aged man away with force.

He stumbled backward, nearly losing his balance.

Seeing her agitated state, he had no choice but to retreat.

After a few steps, he turned back to offer his business card.

But Victoria had already vanished.

His outstretched hand hung awkwardly in the air.

A bodyguard in black approached him quietly.

"Sir, should I have someone else explain things to Ms. Kensington?"

"Not yet," the man sighed heavily. "Give her some time to process this."

Victoria stormed away from the garden.

She pulled out her phone and replied to Rex's text.

[Fine! 80 billion it is. Sell the shares privately—no attention. Prepare my flight for 10 tonight!]

She wasn't rushing without reason.

That man's appearance had unsettled her deeply.

She feared what might happen if she stayed longer.

The situation had spiraled out of control.

Enough was enough.

Her priority now was securing the shares from William and Beatrice.

Coincidentally, they were just leaving Benjamin's hospital room.

"I've prepared gifts for you and Benjamin. His favorite crystal gaming keyboard is included."

"You can bring it to him later. Maybe talking to him will help him wake up sooner."

"Okay," Victoria agreed.

She glanced back at Eleanor and Richard inside the room.

A strange pang of guilt shot through her heart.

After fleeing Westchester, she might never return.

She remembered their kindness over the years.

Part of her felt bad about leaving them like this.

But then she recalled how they took her shares.

How they favored Isabella over her.

How they looked down on her during her lowest moments.

Her eyes turned cold again.

They forced her into this position.

If they had treated her better after that video exposure...

If they had cared more about her feelings...

She wouldn't have to take such drastic measures.

Isabella had been nothing but a menace.

Pushing her to the edge, threatening her very existence.

She had no choice but to run.

With these thoughts hardening her resolve, Victoria followed William and Beatrice to their car.

Meanwhile...

Isabella and Nathaniel sat together in his car.

Nathaniel could still hear her words echoing in his mind.

"So when I find an actual boyfriend, you call it an embarrassment..."

An actual boyfriend...

A slight smirk played on his lips.

Isabella noticed his expression. "You're happy they called you a wild man?"

"I don't mind being your wild man," Nathaniel replied, his voice deep and magnetic.

Isabella choked on her own breath.

Cough! Cough! What kind of logic was that?

He was a man of reputation and status!

Nathaniel leaned back elegantly against the seat. "What's your next move?"

"First, I'll find the best specialists for Benjamin. Get him the proper diagnosis and treatment."

"As for Victoria... Let things unfold naturally."

With William and Beatrice returning home, Isabella wanted to see how far Victoria's cruelty would go.

The family had spoiled her since childhood.

She couldn't possibly be completely heartless.

If she truly was... Then the Montgomery family would learn the hard way.

Sometimes, being hurt was the only way to see someone's true colors...

Isabella took out her phone and texted Maxwell.

[Maxwell: Latest update—Victoria booked a flight for 10 tonight. Should we stop her?]

Isabella's eyes narrowed.

That fast? She's rushing to leave tonight?

After a moment's hesitation, she replied.

[No need. Let her run.]
###Chapter 472

Only Victoria’s abrupt departure made the entire Montgomery family grasp the severity of the situation.

Isabella wanted to witness everyone’s reaction when they finally saw Victoria’s true nature.

At the Kensington estate.

When Victoria, William, and Beatrice returned, they found the mansion completely ransacked.

Sofas were slashed. Tables were overturned. Expensive decor lay shattered across the marble floors.

Beatrice’s hand flew to her chest. “What in heaven’s name happened here?”

“A break-in? The security code was bypassed. I’m checking the cameras.” William stormed toward the security room.

Victoria and Beatrice hurried after him.

The surveillance footage showed a figure in black keying in the passcode with ease.

The intruder systematically combed through the rooms, pocketing valuable jewelry and artifacts.

Then the person turned directly toward the hidden camera and grinned. “A message from Ms. Montgomery. She said you shouldn’t have crossed her. How dare you speak to her like that! She’s taking all your assets within seventy-two hours. Just wait.”

William’s face purpled with rage. Beatrice swayed on her feet, grabbing the desk for support.

Isabella! How could she do this? The sheer audacity!

Not only the invasion, but a direct threat to seize everything they owned in three days?

“That vile, ungrateful wretch!” Beatrice shrieked, her voice trembling with fury.

Victoria rushed to her side. “Grandfather! Grandmother! Please, stay calm. Your health is paramount. If something happens to you, Isabella will get everything. You know Benjamin and I are no match for her. We can’t possibly fight her…! Listening to that… she’s clearly plotting something drastic…”

“Preposterous! I’d rather donate my entire fortune to charity than let that witch inherit a single penny! I’m drafting my will this instant! She gets nothing!” William roared, scrambling for a pen and paper.

A glint flashed in Victoria’s eyes. She gently held his arm. “Grandfather, you’re in perfect health. A will is so… final. But Isabella is cunning. I don’t know what she did, but she manipulated Theodore into giving her twenty-five percent of the Montgomery shares. That’s over forty billion!”

“Even if you write a will now, she might find a way to contest it. To seize it all. I suggest a direct transfer. Move all your assets to Mother first. They’ll be safer with her.”

She sounded utterly sincere, every word dripping with concern.

William scowled. “Your mother is a foolish woman. None of this would have happened if she hadn’t brought that viper into our home!”

Beatrice sighed deeply. “The share transfer requires his signature. We have no idea when he’ll wake up. I have this dreadful feeling… like a storm is coming. This must be settled immediately.”

Her gaze then landed on Victoria, and her eyes lit up. “Victoria! Of course! We’ll transfer everything to you! You are our most trusted granddaughter. We entrust it all to you!”

“No, Grandmother, please… I can’t accept. My reputation is in ruins. No one will have me now. I don’t deserve your generosity…” Victoria hung her head, a picture of shame and guilt.

Beatrice gently took her hand. “You were framed by that wretched girl. Isabella schemed to take what was yours. It’s only right you have this. The incident with Harrison… you were the victim! We don’t blame you. The shares are yours!”

“She’s right. I’m calling my attorney. He’ll be here shortly. Victoria, come with me. I’m giving you the key to my vault.” William already had his phone to his ear, ushering Victoria toward his private vault.

As she followed behind him, a triumphant smirk curled on Victoria’s lips.
###Chapter 473

The sun dipped low as Victoria received the final documents. William and Beatrice Kensington had signed over everything. Every asset, every valuable. All now legally hers.

She clutched the folder tightly. A perfect excuse formed on her lips. She needed to leave the Montgomery Manor immediately. To liquidate it all before anyone could interfere.

William sighed, his own worry evident. "I fear Isabella might still try to take it from Victoria by force."

Beatrice's eyes widened in alarm. "Of course! Victoria now holds sixty percent of the family shares. Plus our personal assets worth billions. Isabella would target her without a doubt! This cannot happen!" She scrambled for her phone. "I'm calling Eleanor. They must protect Victoria at all costs!"

Over at Grace Memorial Hospital...

Eleanor was deep in conversation with a specialist about Benjamin's condition. Her phone's ringtone cut through the sterile air. She excused herself, stepping into the hallway.

"Eleanor, listen carefully!" Beatrice's voice was raspy with urgency. "We confronted Isabella today. She sent thugs to ransack our estate! She threatened to seize all our assets! You must guard the Kensingtons. Protect Victoria. I'm terrified Isabella will harm her next."

"What? Are you certain?" Eleanor's brow furrowed in disbelief. "There must be some mistake. She wouldn't—"

"Would I lie?" Beatrice snapped. "We saw it ourselves! And look at Benjamin! We verified the security footage from Takashi Yamamoto. Benjamin was perfectly fine when he left his home. Who else could have poisoned him but Isabella? Bringing that viper into our family was our gravest error. Will you stand by while she plunders everything? If she could harm Benjamin, Victoria is next!"

Eleanor's grip tightened on the phone. A cold fury began to simmer within her. "Alright," she said, her voice clipped. "I understand. I'll handle it."

She ended the call, her breath coming out in an angry huff. How had Isabella become so monstrous? Poisoning Benjamin wasn't enough? Now she threatened her own grandparents? The sheer audacity was breathtaking.

Just then, Richard approached the hospital room. "Eleanor? I need to meet with Father to finalize the specialist for Benjamin."

"Wait," she commanded, her tone leaving no room for argument. "Come with me to the manor first. We need to force a withdrawal of Isabella's twenty-five percent shares. Before Father finds out."

As the family patriarch, Theodore Montgomery held the corporate seal. Combined with the other shareholders' approval, they could legally revoke her stake.

Richard hesitated. "That's... drastic. You know how Father will react."

"A scolding from Father is preferable to Isabella's schemes!" Eleanor's voice rose. "Do you know what she did? She threatened my parents! She said she would steal everything they own! I am furious, but Father refuses to see the truth! We return her shares to Theodore and cut her from the family. We can explain it to him afterward."

Richard glanced back at Benjamin, lying motionless in the hospital bed. The image solidified his resolve. He gave a grim nod. "Okay."

They returned to Montgomery Manor swiftly. A clandestine family meeting was convened, Theodore deliberately kept in the dark. The vote was unanimous. Isabella Montgomery was to be disowned.

An attorney was summoned. The paperwork for the forced share withdrawal was drafted and signed with swift, brutal efficiency.

Richard then accessed the official Montgomery Group Twitter account. His fingers flew across the keyboard, publishing a statement that would ignite a firestorm.

[Official Statement: Due to Isabella Montgomery's reprehensible actions and conduct endangering lives, the Montgomery family has unanimously voted to disown her and reclaim all family shares. Effective immediately, Isabella Montgomery is no longer the adopted daughter of the Montgomery family. We sever all ties.]

The post exploded across the internet within seconds.

Reprehensible actions? Endangering lives? What did she do?

Insider leak: the Montgomery's only son is in a vegetative state. Unlikely to ever wake up.

What? Isabella did that? I never thought she was capable.

Is this another one of Victoria's setups?

This came from her own parents. They disowned her. This has to be serious.
###Chapter 474

The argument escalated rapidly.

Eleanor accessed her private account and posted a bold statement.

"Our investigations are conclusive and error-free. To seize the Montgomery family assets, Isabella orchestrated schemes against Victoria and Benjamin. This is utterly reprehensible! She knows exactly what she has done!"

Her tweet instantly swayed public opinion.

"Eleanor wouldn't be this furious without solid evidence."

At Rosewood Manor.

Isabella and Nathaniel had just stepped inside when Oliver came rushing toward them.

"Mommy! Mommy! Check Twitter right now! Someone is setting you up!"

Victoria was leaving tonight anyway.

Yes, they had disowned her.

But they would come crawling back to her within a day!

Just as they walked down the hallway...

CRASH. CRASH. SMASH.

The glass windows shattered violently.

Shards flew everywhere, assaulting the trio.
###Chapter 475

Attack!

Glass shards rained down upon his back.

The guards were violently assaulting her manor.

Thirty minutes prior.

Richard had consulted the specialist.

The doctor delivered devastating news.

Benjamin's condition was irreversible.

They had stolen her shares.

Their malice knew no bounds.

A few million meant nothing.

She would teach Isabella a lesson.

An immense, crushing pressure silenced him.

He could feel a pair of sharp, domineering eyes watching from within the building.

A violent shiver ran down his spine.

"Truly, this manor cannot be harmed. Sir, Madam, we must leave. Immediately."

He grabbed Eleanor and Richard's arms, attempting to pull them away.

Eleanor was furious.

"What is inside? Tell me the truth! What trick is she playing?"

The guards were too terrified to stop.

They hurriedly increased their pace, forcibly escorting Eleanor and Richard from the property.

If Nathaniel heard their insolence, the entire Montgomery family could vanish overnight.

Eleanor wanted to teach Isabella a lesson.

She never expected her own guards to betray her.

###Chapter 476

Her heart clenched at his words. She looked down at the boy standing beside her, his crystal-clear eyes filled with unwavering loyalty.

It was ironic. Those who shared her blood sought to destroy her, while those bound by choice stood as her fortress.

A gentle smile touched her lips. "Mommy's alright, sweetheart. Thank you." She squeezed his hand. "Let's get you to bed."

Nathaniel was ascending the staircase when he saw them. He had expected devastation after that confrontation, but Isabella stood composed, her strength evident in her steady posture.

The reptiles would deliver a fitting scare without traceable evidence. Mommy would never suspect a thing.

Even with Victoria's reputation in tatters, the Montgomerys still favored her. They discarded their true daughter for a malicious imposter. Fools.

Maxwell eagerly anticipated their eventual reckoning when the truth finally emerged.

Upstairs, Isabella finished dressing Nathaniel's wound, discarding bloodied gauze into the bin. The sight was gruesome.

"You shouldn't have intervened," she murmured, avoiding his gaze.

"I'm your real boyfriend. Protecting you is my responsibility." He emphasized the title, his voice low.

Isabella felt heat rise to her cheeks. She had said that in the heat of the moment to defy her parents. Why was he latching onto it?

Now wasn't the time for this discussion. "I'm exhausted. I need to rest before dealing with tonight's matters." She stood to leave.

Nathaniel's eyebrow quirked. She didn't correct him... Did that mean she accepted it? His hand shot out, capturing her wrist before she could retreat.
###Chapter 477

Isabella was yanked back by Nathaniel’s firm grip, halting her exit.

“Say the word, Isabella, and I’ll handle everything for you.”
Whether it was Victoria or the entire Montgomery clan.
Why should she endure their daily accusations?

“It will all be over soon.”

The more they despised her, the more thrilling tonight would become.

Isabella slept soundly through the night while the Montgomerys descended into chaos.

The entire family despised their ungrateful adopted daughter.

###Chapter 478

Victoria sold her shares. She emptied the company accounts. She vanished with the bank’s money.

###Chapter 479

Medical staff hurried into the room. They immediately transported Zachary to the adjacent ward for emergency resuscitation.

Shareholders are now personally liable for the remaining debt..." the attorney explained calmly. Amelia's eyes widened in sheer horror. Fifty billion? She was responsible for repaying that? "No! Adam finally snapped out of his dazed state. His first coherent words were a roared command. "Bring her back! We must find her!"

Company employees have looted the offices and fled with anything of value..." The Jordans couldn't even afford to fund a search party. Senior Jordan had remained silent through the entire ordeal. He suddenly coughed violently, spitting a mouthful of blood onto the floor.

The family was in total disarray. Bank representatives would arrive tomorrow. If Senior Jordan fell ill now, the Jordan family would be completely finished.

"Understood, Father. Please, remain calm. Preserve your strength. I will handle everything," Adam vowed, closing his fingers around the precious heirloom.

The jade ring was a centuries-old family artifact. Passed down through countless generations. Now they were forced to sell it for survival. The situation could not possibly be worse.

Joey returned from the other ward and witnessed the scene. Tears streamed down her face silently. Her legs gave way, and she collapsed to the cold floor. "How... how could this happen?" she sobbed, her voice breaking. "Why would Tiffany do this to us? We raised her with love! We gave her everything! Why...?" Her desperate cries echoed in the room.

No one moved to comfort her. Lily shot her a look of pure contempt. "What good are tears now? Your parenting is the real disaster. The daughter you brought home destroyed our family. Your real daughter robbed us blind and vanished."
###Chapter 480

The Montgomery family now faces complete financial ruin.

You two are the primary culprits behind this disaster!

You must take full responsibility for all outstanding debts!

Absolutely! You bear the greatest liability in this situation!

You need to locate Victoria immediately, or the entire Montgomery legacy will collapse!

Even if you find her, the damage to our stock value is already catastrophic!

This will drain our resources beyond recovery!

You will compensate for every single loss we suffer!

The crowd hurled furious accusations at Eleanor.

Eleanor's heart already shattered from the current crisis, now faced relentless scorn from those who once curried her favor.

They were the same individuals who previously flattered her and sought her friendship.

Yet now...

It was Victoria! That deceitful Victoria!

She seized Senior Montgomery's thirty percent company shares and liquidated everything, creating this chaos!

How could she be so utterly heartless? What possible motive drove her to such betrayal?

Adrian slipped away from the hospital room amidst the turmoil.

Outside the hospital, he pulled out his phone to contact Isabella. "Isabella, should I reveal the truth to them now?"

"Not yet. Let them discover it gradually—they'll learn everything in due time. For now, stay by Grandpa's side personally these next few days. Ensure he receives proper care. Also, cover Benjamin's medical expenses on my behalf."

Isabella was resting in her room during the call. She attempted to sleep after ending the conversation.

But her mind swirled with too many thoughts, keeping her awake. She had anticipated this moment for five long years.

Since everything had descended into chaos, so be it. She wanted the entire Montgomery family to witness their beloved Victoria's true nature!

Had they not mocked her for being the adopted daughter and demanded she never set foot on Montgomery property again?

She longed to see their expressions when the truth emerged—Isabella wanted to hear what excuses they could possibly offer!

The following day unfolded exactly as predicted. The Montgomery family descended into total disarray.

All of William and Beatrice's assets had been sold, leaving them completely homeless. The hospital became their only shelter, though the remaining funds in their bank accounts were severely limited.

After covering the exorbitant medical costs, they struggled to afford even basic meals.

When the bank discovered the fifty-billion-dollar loan had vanished, they immediately shuttered every Montgomery Group factory, along with all their hotels and properties.

They issued a five-day ultimatum for debt repayment before initiating asset liquidation.

The Montgomerys' relatives and friends, terrified of being entangled in the disaster, fled instantly. None wished to be associated with the catastrophe.

Even all the household staff abandoned the manor. Senior Montgomery, Richard, Gregory, Penelope, and the rest remained confined to the hospital, surviving on inexpensive hospital food.

Overnight, the Montgomery family's glory evaporated, replaced by desperate circumstances.

Every financial news outlet and social media platform exploded with headlines:

[The Nation's Top Real Estate Empire Declares Bankruptcy!]

[Montgomery Group Shuts Down Operations!]

[Montgomery Family Swamped with 50 Billion Debt!]

[Victoria Kensington Absconds with Family Fortune—Manhunt Underway!]

Comment sections flooded with shock and disbelief.

[Unbelievable! Victoria actually stole their money and ran!]

[That innocent-faced Victoria committed such an act?]

[Isn't she the Montgomery heiress? Even without stealing, she controlled sixty percent of shares. Why would she do this?]

[She fled with the money, making herself universally despised. Is she insane?]

[This year's most sensational drama! Can't wait for the full truth to emerge!]

The public watched the spectacle with morbid fascination. Some investigators dug into the Montgomery family history, uncovering their profound foolishness—they were arguably the most gullible family imaginable.

Victoria had been their favored child since infancy. They invested enormous sums in her upbringing, enrolling her in piano lessons, language courses, and countless other trainings.

Their expenditure on her far exceeded what they spent on their other children. What could have driven her to such betrayal?

BANG!

A sudden, explosive noise reverberated through the hospital ward.
###Chapter 481

Isabella glanced up to see Sophia hurling the food container across the room. The plastic lid popped off, scattering rice and vegetables over the linoleum.

Sophia clawed at her own hair, pulling strands loose from her ponytail. Her eyes were wild with frustration.

"I can't do this anymore! This room smells like disinfectant and misery. I refuse to sleep propped up in that plastic chair again. And this slop they call food? Unacceptable! I need proper lobster. I need to feel human again!"

Eleanor moved to comfort her, hands fluttering nervously. "Darling, you must be patient. The authorities are tracking Victoria across six continents. They'll find her. We just need to hold on a little longer."

"Hold on? With what? Hope?" Sophia's laugh was brittle. "What if she's already blown through everything? What if there's nothing left when they finally catch her? I'm done with this pathetic existence! Fix this, Mother! You have to fix this now!"

A heavy silence filled the room. Gregory shot a venomous look toward Richard and Eleanor. "Look what your family's incompetence has brought upon us. Clean up this mess. That other daughter of yours—the Montgomery heiress. She's rolling in money. Find her. Make her pay for decent accommodations. At least get us out of this hospital hellhole."

Eleanor's head snapped up, a sudden idea flashing in her eyes. She turned to Richard, her meal forgotten. "She's right. Isabella! That ungrateful wretch we took in. This has her fingerprints all over it. Victoria would never do this. She loved us! Isabella must have threatened her. Forced the transfers. Maybe even... eliminated her afterward?"

Richard went rigid, the color draining from his face. The unspoken horror of it settled over everyone.

Penelope shot to her feet, the plastic chair screeching. "Of course! It makes perfect sense! Victoria was the heir. Why would she throw that away? Risk prison? Unless she had no choice! That Montgomery viper! She could have arranged the whole thing! She could have had her killed!"

The air grew thick with dread. Just as Theodore drew a breath to reprimand them, the attorney burst through the door, disheveled and breathless.

"I found something! In the waste bin... pieces... I pieced them together..."

Eleanor snatched the reconstructed page from his trembling hands. The family crowded around, their breaths held.

The handwriting was frantic, desperate.

Why... why wasn't I born a Montgomery? Why is my entire life a lie balanced on a knife's edge?
This constant fear of losing it all is torture! I'm losing my mind!
What gives you the right, Isabella? Just blood? You want to steal the twenty-three years of love I earned?
Why didn't you just die in that damned village?!

Victoria's breakdown was etched in every jagged word. She'd torn the evidence of her turmoil to shreds, a futile attempt to hide her crumbling sanity. The attorney's meticulousness had unearthed her secret.

The paper trembled violently in Eleanor's grip. Her world tilted on its axis.

Victoria... wasn't hers.

Isabella... was?

Impossible.

She had cradled Victoria, had fed her, had soothed her nightmares. Isabella was the charity case, the child from the trash.

This couldn't be real.

Richard stood frozen beside her, his mouth agape, unable to form a single word. The truth was a physical blow.
###Chapter 482

“This can’t be true! Victoria would never write this! There must be some error… Look into it immediately!”

“But… I’ve already verified the handwriting. It’s unmistakably Victoria’s. The document even carries her fingerprints,” the attorney explained helplessly.

What more evidence could they possibly need?

Adrian entered at that precise moment. “There’s no need for further investigation. Isabella is your biological daughter. Years ago, Victoria’s birth mother and Eleanor gave birth in the same hospital. Her mother was dying after delivering Victoria. To secure a better future for her child, that woman secretly switched the babies. She took the true heiress, Isabella, and abandoned her in a trash bin. That’s how Victoria became the Montgomery heiress. This is why your heart ached when you found the baby in the bin. This is why you always treated that foundling better than Victoria.”

Eleanor felt as if struck by lightning. Her pupils dilated in shock.

It was true—her heart had wrenched at the sight of little Isabella in that bin. She had always favored the child she rescued over Victoria. But was that really enough to believe Isabella was her actual daughter?

It sounded absurd.

Everyone in the hospital room was stunned into silence.

Isabella—Eleanor’s real daughter? Victoria was just a swapped imposter? It was too dramatic to believe. It felt like a plot from a soap opera.

Adrian handed over a DNA report. “The day after you exiled Isabella five years ago, she asked me to collect strands of your hair for a DNA test outside Westchester. She tried calling everyone to come home, but all her calls were blocked.

“This new DNA test was conducted yesterday using Isabella and Benjamin’s blood. She always intended to show you, but never got the chance.”

Eleanor, Richard, Theodore, and the others crowded around to read the report. The results were clear: Isabella was undeniably the true Montgomery heiress. She and Benjamin shared the same mother.

The first test might have been done at a hospital outside Westchester, but Grace Memorial was owned by the Blackwood corporation. No matter how powerful Isabella was, she could never have bribed Blackwood staff…

“So… Isabella is actually my cousin?” Sophia murmured, still dazed.

“It does make sense, though,” Gregory added. “Victoria ran off with the money because she knew she wasn’t a real Montgomery. She wanted to destroy the entire family.”

Adrian laughed mockingly. “Oh, it’s much worse than that. Victoria discovered the truth when she was eight. First, she manipulated Benjamin and Isabella, rendering them useless. She planned to seize every share of the family fortune. Five years ago, during Isabella’s engagement party, she overheard Victoria conspiring with Alexander. That’s why they pushed her down the stairs! Victoria has been a demon lurking in the shadows since she was eight, plotting against all of you. And you treated her like royalty! How utterly hilarious.”

His scornful words echoed through the room.

Eleanor’s body jolted violently. Overwhelmed, her blood pressure spiked. She collapsed to the floor, unconscious.

Richard quickly lifted her onto an empty bed. The room descended into chaos again.

Theodore trembled, urgently gesturing to Adrian. “Hurry, find Isabella… Bring her back…!”

“It’s too late, Father,” Richard muttered, his voice thick with regret. Each word felt like a punch to his gut.
###Chapter 483

Richard Montgomery’s expression darkened at his son’s words. “Why?”

“I… We believed Isabella was responsible for the destruction at the Kensington Estate yesterday. So we invoked your authority to revoke her shares and formally disowned her. We even gathered men to storm the Rosewood Manor and insulted her publicly. She… She may refuse to assist us now…” Richard hung his head, the shame of facing Isabella overwhelming him.

The elder Montgomery’s face flushed with rage. “You fools! How could you be so reckless? Did I not explicitly say we wait for Benjamin to regain consciousness? How dare you defy me—cough, cough!”

His coughing intensified with each furious word.

Adrian Sinclair rushed to his side. “Please, sir, remain calm. Let them rectify their errors—don’t sacrifice your health over their foolishness.”

“My health is irrelevant… Isabella is what matters. My true granddaughter all along! Richard, you will go to her and apologize immediately! I don’t care how you do it, but you will bring her back into this family. If you fail, I will disown you as my son!” Senior Montgomery’s voice trembled with fury.
